loans.name: Shargiyya

texts.en: Shargiyya is inhabitant of Agsu district of Azerbaijan. She is 55, a widow, and has 3 children. She started this business in 2001 with her own resources. In 2005-2006 she borrowed 2 loans amount 300-700$ from Normicro Agsu branch and used these loans for business expansion purposes. Now she applies to borrow $1200 for further business development.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Karema

texts.en:
Karema, who was born in 1970, lives in a household of 7 in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Karema shares a business with her husband Mohammad Shah. They have a grocery store in the market.

Due to a lack of family income she took a loan so her husband can buy powder, soup, rice, ghee, beans, peas, cold drinks, sugar, tea ...etc. for the shop.

By selling these goods they are able to improve the family's financial situation and pay the rent of the house and shop as well.

Karema hopes that if her husband's business goes well she can take a 2nd cycle loan for herself, starting a quilt making business. Karema knows a lot about tailoring and quilt making.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Anisa

texts.en:
Anisa is 37 years old and a mother of 4 children. They live in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Anisa has a shared business with her son. They sell corn in the bazaar. Due to a lack of ingredients, she took a loan from AFSG to buy corn, ghee, gas, plastic, salt, etc.

Anisa prepares the ingredients for her son and then her son sells them in the bazaar. Through this process they can cover their family expenses.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, who was born in 1989, lives in a household of 4 in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Maryam took a loan for her older brother who has a cosmetics store in the bazaar where he sells perfume, lipstick, scarfs, purses, etc.

Maryam is studying in year 7 and working part time sewing clothes for neighbours. She took the loan to increase her brother's business and cover her family financially.

loans.use: To buy perfume, lipstick, scarfs, purses, etc.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, who was born in 1973, is a mother of 4 children and lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

During the war she started weaving carpets with her 3 sons at home, but due to a lack of  materials she wasn't able to complete the carpets. Then she took a 1st cycle loan through AFSG to buy thread, wood, carpet patterns and other materials.

Razia's sons are very quick at weaving carpets.   They are able to complete one carpet in six months, after which her husband sells the carpet at the market. Through this process they can make a profit.

loans.use: To buy thread, wood, carpet patterns

loans.name: Idaya

texts.en: Idaya is an IDP from occupied Kelbadjar district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993 and started her business in 1999. In 2000-2006 she borrowed 6 loans from Normicro Baku branch totaling $5000. Now she would like  to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Ugurlu

texts.en: Ugurlu is an IDP from occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993 and started his business in 2000. Married, has a child. To develop the busines he plans to borrow $1000 from Normicro Baku branch, with funding from KIVA.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is an IDP from occupied Kelbadjar district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993. In 2000 he started his business and in 2003-2006 he borrowed three loans totaling $700 totaling from Normicro Baku branch. Now he would like to borrow $1000.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan is low income person from Kedabek district of Azerbaijan. He is Married and has four children. He came to Baku in 1990. In 1994 he started his business. He wants to receive a loan of $1200 from Normicro Baku branch.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is an IDP from occupied Kelbadjar district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is Married and has two children. He started his business in 1995, and borrowed five Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $3500. Now he would like to borrow $1200$ to buy instruments.

loans.use: To buy some instruments for his Construction business

loans.name: Tufaiga

texts.en: Raising four children is a hard job for Tufaiga A. S., aged 58. Her husband does not have a job so the only way they get money is from their small lawn mowing business.  She has tried her best to encourage her husband to continue the business when she joined SPBD Programme in 2005. Her  last loan was 1750 tala (US$800); she used that loan to buy secondhand lawn mowers and to pay school fees for her two children that are still in school.

loans.use: To purchase two additional lawn mowers

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif is a low-income person from Gazax district of Azerbaijan. He moved to Baku in 1993. He is Married and has three children. He started his business in 1995. Now he is would like to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Solopeta

texts.en: Solopeta, 48, is married and has four children. When she joined the SPBD microcredit program the business idea she had in mind was a bit unusual for women -- lawn mowing. But she saw a great opportunity for offering lawn mowing services for the better-off houses in the village. Now her business has proven to be successful and she is proposing to buy two additional brand-new lawn mowers and employ her jobless relatives.

loans.use: To purchase two additional lawn mowers

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en: Khanim is an IDP from occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is Married and has three children. She started this business in 1995, and borrowed four Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $3000. Now she would like to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona, 36, is married to a fisherman and has 4 kids. She started a small retail shop two years ago but was not successful. Then she decided to sell her husband's fish catch herself and found out that she can really be a good entrepreneur. Eventually she started buying the fish catch of other fishermen in the village. Now that her business is growing, she intends to buy four deep freezers so she can store the fish that she is going to sell.

loans.use: To purchase four deep freezers

loans.name: May

texts.en: May, 32, is married to a fisherman in the fishing village of Falefa. She had been doing the selling of the fish caught by her husband. As she became more confident of expanding her fish vending business, she joined a solidarity group organized by SPBD in her village. She got a small loan and used it as working capital to buy more fish from other fishermen. She is now intending to expand her thriving business by buying additional coolers and deep freezers to extend the shelf life of the fish she is selling to neighboring villages.

loans.use: To purchase two additional coolers and two deep freezers

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida was born in 1989 and lives in a household of 3 in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Before, Khalida's husband had a cosmetics cart and sold cosmetics materials but due to problems he decided that his wife should take a loan from AFSG to start a new business, a wood shop, because selling wood in the bazaar carries higher benefits than the cosmetics cart.

Khalida thinks that if she is a good client for AFSG, she can take a 3rd loan cycle for herself. She would buy a new machine and table so that she can sew more clothes which her son can then sell in the bazaar. With this business she is able to contribute to her family's income.

loans.use: Buying wood, axes, and a car

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria R., 26, married and started her business just after her last year in school; that was the only way she earned money for her young family. She joined the microcredit programme of SPBD in 2005 after facing a lot of difficulties with her small business.  After her first loan with SPBD she started to recover and her retail store is now expanding and providing  steady income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (soft drinks, food stuffs) for her retail shop

loans.name: Lauina

texts.en: “ I will never forget the help that I get from the SPBD! “ Lauina always says that to her friends and family. She also adds that without the microcredit program she wouldn't have money to send her five children to school. She joined the program in 2004 while she was still starting up her sewing business. She faced many difficulties because of not enough money to support her business and the family. But now she is starting to expand her number of customers and with an additional sewing machine and more material she is sure to earn from her thriving sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine, 20 rolls of fabric, and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying inventory

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Isabellla, 37, is married and has four children. Her husband also does farming. She joined SPBD Microcredit Programme in 2005 and that is the only organisation that she believes can help her and her business. She used her first loan to establish her taro farm in the village. Now, she is proposing to expand her farm and needs a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides for her taro farm

loans.name: Fololina

texts.en: Fololina never gives up on her business because she is sure that “she can earn more money from her farm.” Her husband doesn't have another job but instead helps her with the farm work. She sells her bananas in the town market while her husband tends the farm. It is a lively joint family business which sustains their family needs.

loans.use: To purchase planting materials, organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima, 33, is married and has 5 children. She joined the SPBD Program in 2004. Her business is selling handicrafts, lava lava, and assorted cosmetics in a flea market stand. Her small enterprise has been able to meet family needs and send her children to school. With her proposed loan she would be able to expand the inventory of her flea market stand.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods to be sold in her flea market stand

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Aitu

texts.en: Aitu, 35, is married with three children. She joined the microcredit program in 2005. She used her first loan to establish a taro farm. Her husband does most of the farm work while she goes to the market three times a week to sell their taro. Their small farm is expanding and now she needs more capital to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides.  She is contemplating starting another business but she thinks she has to concentrate first on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia took a loan for her father Mohammad Zaman, who has a wood shop in the bazaar. Here he sells all kinds of wood.

Zakia is single and lives with her family in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Zakia does not have an education but she knows quilt making. Now, she helps her father increase his business and buy more wood so that he can improve the family income. Once she has finished repaying this loan she wants to take a 3rd loan cycle for herself.

loans.use: Buying wood, axes, a cart

loans.name: Vaoesea

texts.en: Vaoesea, 35, is married and has recently established a refrigeration service with her husband. This business is successful because people living on the west coast do not have to come into town but stop by Faleula for repair and servicing of their refrigerators. Coming into town is expensive for families that live in rural areas. Vaoesea’s repair and servicing shop is the only one on the west coast of the island of Upolu.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment for servicing refrigerators

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a candle making machine

loans.name: Ufiufi

texts.en: Ufiufi, 29, married, specializes in producing staple foods for the local market and  families in the village. Staple foods such as yam, taro, and bananas are the main products of her farm. Despite the many farmers in Samoa, staple food is in high demand every day. This is why she is successful. Another reason is that apart from selling at the local market, the business also caters to families in Ufiufi’s village.

loans.use: To purchase planting materials, organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Teuila

texts.en: Teuila, 39, married, specializes in producing and harvesting peanuts to sell to local businesses and local people. The business is successful, as families living in New Zealand or Australia usually take peanuts overseas. She sells her produce at the market, already packed, for a reasonable price. She also delivers so because of this she gets to more businesses than having the buyers come to her.

loans.use: To purchase peanut seeds, organic fertilizers, pesticides and additional farm implements

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica M. is 43 years of age and is married to a church pastor. She has four children, and , together with her younger sister, also takes care of her aging mother. 

She also has two grandchildren whom she supports, since her daughter, their mother, does not have any means to earn an income. Monica lives in the Kayole area of Nairobi, which is an informal settlement where many poor people reside. Since she is the Pastor's wife, she also assists her husband to take care of some of the church members who are in dire need.

Monica has been doing salon work including hair and beauty for about 20 years. She started off her small salon and training business in 2004, with money that she received through a merry go round group that she was involved in. She used the money  to buy a hair drier, a few seats, a mirror, and some hair chemicals.

Since 2006, Monica has been receiving short contracts to train students in need coming from the Kayole area, who are sponsored to learn vocational skills by the World Vision Organization. However, Monica has been experiencing problems.  First, she only has seven seats and 15 students. Second, she only has one hair drier and the students have to wait for long periods. She sometimes even loses clients to other salons because they have to wait for very long periods.

Monica is a member of the Kisima group of Action Now Kenya within the Kayole area, and she has so far received a loan of $57, which she used to purchase required chemicals and beauty products for her business.

Monica now seeks a loan of $500, whose repayment period will be between 12 - 18 months. Monica would purchase 10 seats, 2 blow driers, one hair drier and one training dummy. This support would go a long way in enabling her to provide faster services to her clients hence save much of their time, and her students would also have a more comfortable learning atmosphere. She also hopes that once she completes this loan repayment, she can receive an additional loan that she will use to buy other additional equipment that her business requires.

loans.use: To purchase 10 seats, 2 blow driers, One hair drier and one training dummy

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi is IDP from armenian occupied Fizuli region. Now he is settled in Beylagan region with his family. He rents a booth in the market of Beylagan town since 2001. In 2002, he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed first loan in amount of $400 to buy goods for sale. Subsequently he borrowed $500, $600, and $700 from Normicro. Now he needs $1000 to invest in his business and increase working capital.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en:
Zemfira was born in 1954 in the Kalbadjar region.  She is married and has 4 children. She saved enough money to set up a business. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she bought a calf.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 3 calves. She is optimistic about her future and hopes she can use the extra profits to provide a better living for the children.
Zemfira has run this business for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir is 34 and he is the resident of Beylagan town. He has his own booth where he sells parfumery products. He runs this business since 2005. His first loan was in amount of $400 from Normicro Beylagan branch. His next loan was in amount of $600. Now he needs $1000 to increase the variety of goods and increase the volume of sales.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lydia wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, salt, soaps, and dairy meal

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is IDP from war torn Khojavand region and now he is settled in Beylagan region. He is quite young. In 2005 he decided to start his own business and built a shop. In 2005 he borrowed $300 from Normicro Beylagan branch and bought goods to be sold in the shop. His next loan was in amount of $600. Now he needs $1000 to increase the variety of goods and expand the business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Talaitupu

texts.en: Talaitupu, 48, married, hails from a village of crab fishers. They have a special art of catching crabs and this is why their business is successful. It is also because their backyard is where they do all the fishing. This woman is familiar with the times of high and low tide and can predict when it is the right time to take out the nets to catch big or small crabs, selling to locals and other businesses in town. Crabs are a delicacy that is most loved by tourists and families from overseas.

loans.use: To purchase additional crab catching equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy welding tools and metal materials for the family's welding workshop

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is the resident of Beylagan town, she is married and has 2 children. She rents a booth in the market to earn the living. She is doing the business since 2003. In 2004 she she borrowed $400 from Normicro Beylagan branch to buy goods to be sold. She took three loans, last one amounting $700. Loans have  contributed considerably to her business and now she needs $1100 to expand the business even more.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ulker is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person.She has had her business for 3 years and it allows  her to support her family.
Ulker is 38,an IDP Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in the Khirdalan settlement.  She is married and has 3 children.
Having borrowed $500 she bought an oven and manufactured products; flour, sugar and hazelnuts. 
She bakes our national sweets such as bakhlava, shakarbura, shorkogal etc. 
She has had her business at home.
Her effort and enthusiasm have led her to achieve what she has today and each day she works harder to grow. 
Now Ulker needs a loan of $1000 to buy a big oven.
She is optimistic that her business will succeed as she will be able to supply different types of products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a big oven

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: Temukisa is a 55-year-old widow who specializes in producing and selling peanuts to local markets and individuals on request. This business is successful as Temukisa also sells at the local market and businesses in her village.

loans.use: To purchase peanut seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Jabbar

texts.en: Jabbar J. is IDP from Fizuli region that is still under occupation. He rents a shop and sells men's clothing of different kinds. He is engaged in this business since 2002. He is one of the best clients of Normicro Beylagan branch. He borrowed 4 loans first amounting $450 and the last amounting $900. Thanks to these loans he has developed his business. Now he needs new loan to buy new seasonal clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy new clothing inventory to sell.

loans.name: Sisili

texts.en: Sisili, 46 years old and married, has three years' experience in the fishing industry in Samoa. Sisili now runs two fishing boats, which is more than other families in this line of business have. This is one of the reasons why she is successful. The catch is always fresh and is sold at the Fish Market once the fishing team arrives from sea.

loans.use: To improve fishing boats and purchase new nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy foodstuffs, laundry detergents, soft drinks, cereals and beverages for her shop

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en: Alasgar is 52 year old local. Since 2001 he has rented a booth in local market. He borrowed 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan branch and he has a good repayment history. His first loan was in amount of $400 and the last one was in the amount of $800. Now he needs $1000 to build his own shop and not to pay the rent for the booth in the market.

loans.use: To build his own shoe shop

loans.name: Samaya

texts.en:
Samaya is a 53 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region. She has settled in the Absheron region. She is married and has 5 children.
She has a high education, and taught English at school.Her goal in life to see her children graduate and become independent.
She has had her business for 2 years.
Samaya is proud of having succeeded in her business and for having paid her children's tuition. The first time she borrowed  $400 and bought ice cream apparatus for making ice cream.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 big refrigerators.

loans.use: To buy 2 big refrigerators

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela has been in this line of business for the past four years. She has great talent and understands the market for all kinds of handicrafts. The business specializes in fine mats, Samoan war weapons, and other handicrafts. Samoa is host to many tourists throughout the year so the handicrafts she creates never just lie around. There are also many Samoan occasions that create the need for these handicrafts so she is never left with too many at one time.

loans.use: To buy paint, flax and chicken feathers to improve the standard and design of created handicrafts

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is 48 year old IDP from Jabrayil region that is still under occupation. After arrival and settlemnt in Beylagan town she rented a small place in the market to contribute to her family. Having no funds of her own she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed 4 loans first in 2001 amounting $200 and her last in 2006 amounting $900. Now she is in need of another loan to increase the inventory.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
This single man was born in 1981 in Salyan region Yenikand village. He has had his business for 5 years and it allows him to support his family.
Now he needs a loan of $800  to renovate space for repairing tires and the necessary equipment: a compressor and furnace and to organize the buying and selling of used and new tires

loans.use: To organize the buying and selling of used and  new tires

loans.name: Omeka

texts.en: Omeka is 58, married, and has more than ten years' experience in sewing. Her business caters to locals, mostly people from her village. Her business is successful because people believe that it is cheaper to buy tailored clothes than ready-made ones. Her experience has gained her many customers some of whom come from overseas to buy her tailored clothes and designs.

loans.use: To purchase material and sewing tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy varieties of green vegetables for her green grocer

loans.name: Tebiet

texts.en:
Tebiet was born in Khaladj village, Salyan region. She is  married and has 3 children.
Tebiet has 20 years of experience in this business. She has steady clients who order products every day.

Having borrowed $400 she bought 15 lambs.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 20 sheep. This business will allow her family to have a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy 20 pregnant sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy different vegetables for her grocery

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region ,settled in  Absheron region, Masazir village.

Sevda has had her own grocery store for 4 years. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain loyal customers.

Having borrowed $400, she bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 refrigerators.
Her business success will allow her to help her with family expenses.

loans.use: To buy 2 refrigerators

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima was born in 1964 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is  married and has 2 children. She likes animals. She breeds chickens, ducks and turkeys.
Her neighbors know her and buy animals from her. She has a lot of customers.  Every day she goes to the market and stores to offer her products.
She has run her business for 10 years.
Now Salima needs a loan of $1000 to buy 10 sheep and  60 chickens.
This is her only sources of income. With this business she supports her family.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep, 60 chickens

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is 56 year old IDP from Fizuli that is still under the control of armenian troops. After facing many hardships of being an IDP, in 2001 she rented a place in  the local market and started the business of selling women shoes. She borrowed 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first in 2001 amounting to $200 and last one in 2005 amounting $600. Now she is in need of $1000 to invest in her business and increase the variety of shoes to be sold.

loans.use: To increase the variety of shoes in her store

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Almaz is 40 year old IDP from armenian occupied Khojavand region. She is now living in Beylagan town. In 2004 she rented a place in the market and started the business of selling women shoes. In 2005 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed her first loan in amount of $500. Her next loan was in amount of $800. Loans were invested in business and now she is in need of another loan.

loans.use: To increase the volume of her store sales

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir is 38 year old local resident. He has a place in market place where he sells drugs for veterinary use. He is engaged in this business since 2002. Since 2003 he is the active client of Normicro Beylagan branch. He borrowed 4 loans, first in 2003 amounting to $500 and last one amounting $900. Now he wants to take another loan to increase the volume of sales.

loans.use: To increase the volume of sales

loans.name: Asker

texts.en: Asker is 31 year old local resident and he has his own shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories. He is doing this business since 2003. He borrowed 3 loans between 2004 and 2006, $200, $600 and $800. He invested loans in business, to buy new models of phones. Now he needs $1200 for the same purpose.

loans.use: To buy new models of mobile phones to sell to his customers

loans.name: Elmir

texts.en: Elmir is a young IDP from Fizuli region. He is 29 years old. He has established his business in 2002. He has a pharmaceutical shop. His business developed thanks to 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan branch. During 2003-2006 he borrowed $400, $500, $600 and $900. All loans were invested in expansion of the business. Now he needs $1100 to increase the variety of drugs he can offer his customers.

loans.use: To increase the variety of drugs available to his customers

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en: Maharram is local and lives in Beylagan town. He has a shop and sells fruit and vegetables. He is doing this business since 2003. In beginning of his business he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $200. After investing the loan into the business he applied for subsequent loans. Eventually be borrowed 4 loans. Now he needs another loan to invest more into his own business.

loans.use: To invest in his Fruits and Vegetables business

loans.name: Afila

texts.en: Afila is 49 year old IDP from occupied Fizuli region. Her family had difficulties in earning a living so she decided to start a business. She rented a shop to sell fruit and vegetables near market place. To start the business she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $200 at first and then $400 and $500. Thanks to these loans she increased the volume of her sales. Now she is in need of new loans for the same purpose.

loans.use: To increase the volume of sales

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is IDP from Jabrail region that is under control of Armenians. He now lives in Beylagan town and has a shop where he is doing his business, selling food stuffs. When he started the business he had no funds, therefore he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $300 at first. Later he borrowed $500, $600 and last $800. He established his business thanks to these loans. Now he cooperates with Normicro and wants new loan from KIVA to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for ice cream storage

loans.name: Alida

texts.en:
Alida is 33 years old, an IDP Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in the Absheron region. She is married and has 3 children.

Alida has a small store where she sells agricultural produce.  She has had this business for 2 years. 
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought agricultural produce.
The second loan of $800 she spent to start sale of industry goods in additions to agricultural produce.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to repair her shop and to buy additional equipment.

She is optimistic that her business will succeed as she will be able to supply different types of customers daily.

loans.use: To repair her shop and to buy additional equipment

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en:
Nicat was born in 1980 in Khaladj village, Salyan region. He has run this business for 4 years. This single man saved enough money to set up this business. This is his only sources of income.
He needs a loan of $600 to buy 12 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 12 pregnant sheep

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years old and married with five children aged 1,5,10,12 and 14. She is also looking after two relatives who are orphans. One is joining senior five and another one soon will be joining college.

Rita is knitting sweaters. She acquired the skill from her in-laws in 1996. She is currently using a knitting machine which produces 10 sweaters per day. The children sweaters are sold for US $6.  Adult sweaters are sold for US $12.

She wants to acquire industrial knitting machine which can produce 50 sweaters a day. The big machine will enable Rita to get big contracts of supplying schools with sockings, sweaters and be able to make other products like bed covers, scarves, skirts and blouses.

The industrial machine uses yarn in form of cones whose products are highly demanded by schools.The acquisition of a big machine is likely to reduce the costs of production and increase her profitability.

loans.use: Acquire Knitting machine

payments.comment: Rita has paid back the first installment.The business is doing well.Thank you for your support.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is 26 years old and lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region. She is single.
She needs a loan of $1000 to buy a 0,3 hectare clover plot of land.Bahar has 8 years of experience in this business. 
This business has enabled her to cover most of her household expences.

loans.use: To buy 0,3 hectare clover plot of land

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
This 33-year-old young woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Absheron region, Masazir village. She is married and has 2 children.
She has had her own grocery store for 2 years.
Having borrowed  $400 she built the store in the yard of her house.
For the second loan she borrowed $800 and bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to increase variety of goods and to buy a refrigerator.
This business has allowed her family to have a better income.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is 27 years old single farmer who lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. She has been in this business for 4 years.
Having borrowed $300, she bought a 0.1 hectare plot of land.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy 8 pregnant sheep in order to start sheep-breeding.
She earns her income from this business. This has enabled her to cover most of her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy 8 pregnant sheep to start sheep-breeding

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 34 years old and is married with two children 5 and 2 years. He looks after his late uncle's five children. Three are in primary 3,5 and 7 and two in secondary 2 and 5.

Lawrence has been working as an employee for the owners of the motorcyle trasport business for the last five years. He wants to get a loan to buy his own motorcycle.

He is intending to start up a chicken rearing project in the future after completing the loan of US $1200.

loans.use: Purchase of motor bike.

payments.comment: The business is doing well and Lawrence is paying back the loan
The business is doing well and Lawrence is paying back the loan
Correction of multiple payments posted in error on April 22, 2007 by SAO.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is 36 years old, married with two childen aged 4 years and 7 years. He also supporting seven relatives. Six of them are in secondary school and one is completing his first degree at University.

He has been doing the business of printing stationery in the last 10 years. The business is located in the city center on Kampala. He supplies offices and small organisations.

He wants a loan of US $ 1200 to be able to buy inputs in bulk to be able to minimize on the cost of production and supply big institutions.

loans.use: Increase working capital

payments.comment: The business is doing well although business has been interrupted by demostrations in Kampala for not giving a way a natural forest to sugarcane growing.This has been coupled with tear gas.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. She is married and has 3 children.
4 years ago she started her business. She enjoys cooking our national tasty dishes such as dolma, ash, khingal, kabab  etc.
All in her region praise her dishes.In addition to our national dishes, she cooks the dishes of other nationalities.
She needs a loan of $1000 to buy kitchen appliances.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Famil

texts.en:
Famil was born in 1978 in Yenikand village, Salyan region. He is single.
He has a 5 hectare plot of land. He plans to buy 600 kilograms of wheat in order to seed this plot of land.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 meaty calves.

loans.use: To buy 600 kilograms of wheat and 2 meaty calves

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina has been engaged in this business at home for 4 years., She is 37, married, has 2 children,and  lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region. She wants to increase the number of her clients but she cannot  because she has a small house.
Now she needs a loan of $700 to buy 500 stones, sand and 5 sacks of cement in order to build her own laundry.
This loan will help to bring about her wishes.

loans.use: To buy 500 stones, sand and 5 sacks of cement in order to build a laundry

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
This young woman was born in 1979 in Salyan region Yenikand village. She is married and has a child.
She has run this business for 10 years.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy 10 sheep in order to improve her agricultural business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Derme

texts.en:
Derme was born in Salyan region Yenikand village. She is married and has 3 children.
Derme has run this business for 30 years. She is the sole provider for her family’s livelihood.
She grows vegetables for sale at the local market.
She plans to intensify growing of vegetables and to grow fruits. 
Now she applies for a loan of $800 to buy good quality seeds and 4 sacks of fertilizer.
The success of her business will have a positive impact on Derme’s income level.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and 4 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Semed

texts.en:
Semed has his own grocery store. He has run this business for 6 years. 
Having borrowed $400 he built his store. The second time he borrowed $500 and with $1000 of his own money he bought 10 sacks sugar, 2 sacks rice, soups, powders etc.
Now he needs a  loan of $1000 to expand the area of his store.
Semed is 29, single and lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region.

loans.use: Sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Malahet

texts.en:
Malahat wants to improve her sheep-breeding. She has been in this business for 10 years. She lives in Salyan region Yenikand village, is married and has 5 children.
This is her only source of income. 
Malahat needs a loan of $1000 to buy 20 pregnant sheep

loans.use: To buy 20 pregnant sheep

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is a 38 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Absheron region. He is married and has 3 children.
He cleans and feeds the sheep and cows and sells their meat in the bazaar. He does not have a butcher shop and it is obstacle for him to improve his business. 
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to build a butcher shop which will help to get a good income and meet the needs his family.

loans.use: To build a butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: para poder comprar: víveres y embutidos

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo tiene su negocio de ebanistería. Desde joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en la madera, haciendo muebles para las casas, especialmente camas. El tiene una casa y tiene ubicado allí su negocio. Todos los del sector lo conocen por su trabajo y son ellos que les recomiendan más clientes. Arturo todos los días atiende el negocio.

Gracias a su trabajo él ha podido mantener su hogar y educar a sus hijos que ya son independientes. Él esta solicitando para un préstamo y desea comprar: madera ya que al llegar la temporada de lluvia, ésta escasea y es más cara.

Arturo nació en Manabí, tiene 68 años, con 7 hijos. Su esposa todavía lo acompaña. Ella ha sido su gran apoyo en el hogar. Arturo toda su vida ha trabajado y a pesar de su edad lo sigue haciendo. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron educar a sus hijos y actualmente ellos tienen sus propios negocios. Su trabajo es su único ingreso que tiene y no desea ser mantenido de sus hijos. Además el trabajo lo mantiene activo.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Arturo has a furniture-making workshop. Since he was young, Arturo has been working with wood making furniture, especially beds. He owns a house and that’s where his workshop is. All the people in his neighborhood know his work and they are the ones who recommend more clients to him. Arturo opens his workshop everyday.

Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to provide for his home and give education to his children, all of which are now independent. Arturo is applying for a loan to buy wood, because when the rain season comes, wood becomes scarce and more expensive.

Arturo was born in Manabí, he’s 68 and has 7 children. His wife still keeps him company and has been a great support for their home. Arturo has worked his whole life and despite his old age, he is still working. Thanks to both of their efforts, they were able to educate their children and nowadays they all have their own businesses. Arturo’s work is his only source of income and he doesn’t want to depend on his children. Also, work keeps him active.

loans.use: para comprar madera y arreglar un motor

loans.name: Sonnia

texts.en:
Sonnia se dedica a elaborar collares, pulseras, aretes en pedrería. Hace todo lo que el cliente le pida. Tiene 4 años haciendo esta actividad. Ella cuenta que una vez que la despidieron de su trabajo comenzó a caminar y se detuvo en un bazar y vio como hacían las pulseras, la dueña del bazar la invitó para que observara y se quedó en el bazar viendo. Su esposo le prestó $ 200, y comenzó su negocio de esta manera.

Ella sale a recorrer a los bazares, amistades y recomendadas. Siempre pide el 50% adelantado y el saldo contra entrega. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar: piedras, canutillos, argollas y adornos, para poder elaborar mayor modelos.

Sonnia nació en Ancón. Tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos. Su esposo es ebanista y ha sido un apoyo fuerte en su hogar. Ellos son una familia muy humilde pero muy trabajadora. Ambos han tenido que trabajar desde muy joven para poder tener sus bienes. Actualmente tienen su casa que poco a poco la han mejorado. Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio y arreglar un espacio de su casa para poner su bazar donde pueda exhibir sus creaciones.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Sonnia creates collars, bracelets and earrings using different stones and she has been doing this activity for 4 years. She says that once she was fired from her work, she started to walk around and stopped at a store where she saw how the owner was making bracelets. The owner invited Sonnia in and let her observe. Her husband lent her $200 and so she started her business.

She offers her products to stores, friends and people she’s been recommended to. She always asks for 50% in advance and the rest is paid after the product is delivered. She needs the loan to buy stones, rings and decorations so that she can create more and different models.

Sonnia was born in Ancón. She is 44 and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and has been a great support for their home. Their family is humble but very hard working. Both Sonnia and her husband have had to work since they were very young so that they could have the goods they have now. Nowadays, they own a house that they have improved little by little. Their goal is to see their business grow and to make a space in their house so Sonnia can put up a shop where she can exhibit her creations.

loans.use: Para comprar: piedras, canutillos, argollas, adornos

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo tiene 3 años vendiendo: tomate, cebolla, pimiento, toda clase de legumbres según la época. Su negocio está ubicado en uno de los mercados y tiene buena concurrencia. Después de haber sido cancelado de su anterior trabajo como guardia de seguridad no encontraba trabajo. Se acordó de lo que antes hacía, es decir, vendía en la calle y nuevamente retomó su actividad.

Él atiende el negocio de lunes a domingo de 5:00AM a 2:00PM. Su hijo le ayuda y también tiene otro puesto. Gracias a los ingresos del negocio han podido tener su casa. Él necesita el préstamo para poder surtir sus legumbres como: papa, col, y tomates. Tiene la suficiente demanda para colocar sus productos.

Bernardo nació en Vinces. Tiene 38 años. Con 3 hijos. Su esposa se dedica a su hogar atendiendo a los niños. Ella también le ayuda en el negocio. Bernardo desde joven trabajó en el campo como agricultor junto a sus padres, a los 20 años decidió salir a la ciudad para mejorar su condición de vida. Se casó y tuvo que trabajar en lo que podía. Actualmente su negocio les ha permitido educar a sus hijos, tener su casa y hacerle mejora. Su aspiración es seguir creciendo y que su hijo se independice con el negocio que ya tiene pero que es muy pequeño.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

For the past 3 years, Bernardo has been selling tomatoes, onions, peppers and all sorts of vegetables, depending on the season. His business is located at one of the markets and has a lot of activity. After being fired from his last job as a security guard, he couldn’t find work. Then, he remembered what he used to do, which was to sell on the streets, and took up that activity once again.

Bernardo opens his business from Monday to Sunday from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm. He also has another stand where his son helps. Thanks to his income, Bernardo has been able to buy a house. He needs the loan to supply his stands with vegetables such as potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes; there is a great demand for these products.

Bernardo was born in Vinces. He is 38 and has 3 children. His wife stays at home taking of their children. She also helps with the business. Since he was young, Bernardo worked in the fields as a farmer with his parents. When he turned 20, he decided to go to the city so he could improve his quality of life. There, Bernardo got married and worked on whatever job he could get. Nowadays his business has allowed him to continue educating his children, own his own house and improve it. He wishes for his business to continue growing and for his children to become independent with the business that he has already established, but that is still very small.

loans.use: para comprar legumbres como: papa, col, tomates y un exhibidor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For Restocking

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick O. has been in the electronic repair business for the last five years and the business has been able to provide for his family. He is married and has two children, one that attends school. He also takes care of his aging parents. He has taken loan management and business skill training with the Rural Agency for Development (Rafode).

He is seeking a loan of $950 to buy spare electronic parts in bulk to sell to his clients who come for his services. He will also sell to other electronic repair dealers in the area. He will use the profit to diversify his business, buy a cow for his parents, and save for future use. He is capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: Buy electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher A. has been in the clothing business for the last 7 years. Her business has enabled her to educate her children and take care of her ailing mother.

She is educated up to level 7. She is seeking a loan to restock her business as she used a large amount of her savings to pay for school fees in January. The loan will help her to buy more cloth. She intends to use her savings to buy a plot and medical insurance for the children as well as save for future use.

loans.use: Restocking and diversification

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice has been in the food business for the last five years. He is single but takes care of his parents. He started the business with $100 which he borrowed from a friend. He has taken a loan from ECLOF and repaid the loan successfully.

He is seeking a loan to expand his business by opening new branches and buying quality cows to slaughter for meat. He currently relies on other traders who do not supply quality meat.

He will use his profit to marry, buy two cows and build a house at home.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Caroline she is married and has two children. She is educated to level 12 and she has undergone training in Business Management and Loan Use from the Rural Agency for Development (Rafode).

She seeks a loan to expand her retail business, build a good shelter where she can display her goods, and restock a variety of important ingredients such as tomatoes and other vegetables. Her business serves people who are working.

She intends to use the profit to provide medical care for her family, pay school fees and refurbish her house.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married and has four children who attend school. He started his shoe business in 1997 and his business has been able to feed his family since then.

He has undergone training in business management and loan use from the Rural Agency for Development (Rafode).

With his loan, he wants to buy shoes in wholesale and resell them both retail and wholesale.

He intends to use the income to pay for medical insurance and school fees as well as buy a plot to build a house for the family.

loans.use: BUYING STOCKS.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi J. owns a small shop of household items in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Vidadi is looking for funding so that he can increase the variety of his inventory in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase Quality and Quantity of store inventory

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir J. owns a small clothing store in the town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Nadir wants to increase the quality and diversity of his inventory so that he can increase his client base.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and quality of his inventory.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq R. owns a small stand in the town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Natiq’s store sells newspapers and general school supply/stationary items. He would like to invest in a more diversified inventory so that he can offer his current customers as well as attract new customers.

loans.use: To incresase and diversify his store's inventory.

loans.name: Sarufa

texts.en: Sarufa I. owns a small clothing/fabric stand in the town of Devech’s Bazaar. Devechi is located just south of Khachmaz in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Sarufa is looking for fundng so that she can invest in higher quality fabrics and increase the diversity of her inventory.

loans.use: To invest in higher quality fabric and clothing for her store.

loans.name: Guler

texts.en:
Guler is a Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Fizuli. She settled with her family in Sumgayit city after her displacement. She is a 42-year-old widow with three children. Guler lost her husband during the war. In spite of all her difficulties, she started her own business six years ago selling clothing and apparel.
She applies for this loan to increase the  assortment of goods she sells.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa K. owns a small bedding stand in the town of Devech’s Bazaar. Devechi is located just south of Khachmaz in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Latifa wants to be able to increase the diversity of her inventory so that she can attract more customers to her small stand.

loans.use: To diversify her inventory to attract more customers to her bedding stand

loans.name: Batura

texts.en: Batura S. owns a small clothing stand in the town of Devech’s Bazaar. Devechi is located just south of Khachmaz in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Batura wants to increase the diversity and quality of her inventory so that she can attract more customers to her stand in the Bazaar.

loans.use: To increase the diversity and quality of her inventory so that she can attract more customers.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz K. owns a small store of general household items in the small town of Devechi. Devechi is located just south of Khachmaz in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Gulnaz is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and quality of her inventory. She feels that a more varied inventory will increase her customer base.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 32, married, and has 2 children. Nadir has lost his parents in war. He sells flowers. Nadir applies for the loan $1200 to open his own flower-shop and increase the flower assortments.

loans.use: To open his own flower-shop and increase the flower assortments

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is 35 and has one child. He works as a chauffeur. He works on public transport. He began his business 19 years ago and it allows him to support to his family. In 2005 he borrowed $800 from Normicro spent this loan to repair his cars motor. His minibus is old. Therefore he plans to sell it and buy a new minibus.
Mahir applies for a loan amount of $1200 to buy a new minibus.

loans.use: To buy a new minibus

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Jabrail region, settled in Sumgait city and has 4 children. This 59-year-old woman has been engaged in her business for 8 years. Firangiz sells women’s clothes. She supports her family with this business. Now Firangiz needs a loan amount of $1200 to be busy with selling the women's clothing

loans.use: To be busy with selling the women's clothing

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Jabrail region, settled in Sumgait city and has 2 children. This 43-year-old woman has been engaged in her business for 5 years. Arzu sells women’s clothes. She supports her family with this business. Now Arzu needs a loan amount of $1100 to be busy with selling the clothing.

loans.use: To be busy with selling the industrial goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy fertilizers and organic manure for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more stock for her household store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy matchboxes, plastic utensils, laundry detergents, beverages for her  retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a high-breed dairy cow and 50 chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy 20 chickens and their feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy dairy feed and other supplements for her cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy organic manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his parents in Sumgait city. Rahim has been working as a barber since he was 19 years old. Now he is 27. He used to work at a barber shop but decided that he wanted to start his own business. This room is clean and professional though bare. 
Rahim needs a loan amount of  $1200 to buy equipment and instruments, additional tables and lighting for his salon.

loans.use: To buy equipment and instruments, additional tables and lighting for his hair salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy dairy feed and other dairy supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase dairy feed

loans.name: Gorkhmaz

texts.en:
33-year-old Gorkhmaz with his 2 children settled in out-of-town Sumgait, Jorat settlement. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2002 Gorkhmaz has been engaged in animal husbandry and animal sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 2 loans ($500; $800;) from Normicro, Gorkhmaz significantly expanded his business, has bought 14 sheep, achieved progress in his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back timely.
He applies for a loan amount of $1200 to buy 12 more sheep.

loans.use: To buy 12 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy organic manure and build a temporary business premises for selling it.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima is a lady who operates a table-top shop in her community. She sells items such as soaps, sugar, gari, biscuits, batteries, milk powder, milo, milk, etc., to the people in her locality. She also sells cooked rice and beans, locally called wakye, in front of her kiosk. For some time now she has not been able to buy goods for her shop due to insufficient capital. She is therefore seeking a loan of $750 from Kiva to support her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more bananas and fertilizers

loans.name: Balashirin

texts.en: Balashirin is originally from Lerik region of Azerbaijan. He now lives in Sumgayit city and has been working for the past eight years as a taxi driver. He is married, but has no children. Balashirin is asking for a loan to repair his taxi.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Garyagdi

texts.en: Garyagdi is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbajar region of Azerbaijan. He re-located with his wife and two children to Sumgayit. He is 42 years old. Difficulties of life forced him to start using his car as a taxi in order to earn a living. Garyagdi currently needs a loan in order to make repairs on this vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is a lady who trades in fabrics from textile factories and "tie-dye" that she makes herself at home. She sells to a very large group of people in her community. Usually she buys the fabrics in bulk and retails it to her customers and the general public but of late she is not able to buy from the company anymore because she lacks the supporting capital. Therefore she is seeking a loan of $1000 from Kiva. She is capable of paying it back.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zanfira

texts.en: Zanfira is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city,  and has 2 children. This 51-year-old woman has been engaged in a carpet factory for 18 years. Zanfira used to work at a weaving factory but decided that she wanted to start her own business. She supports her family with this business. Now Zanfira needs a loan amount of $1200 to buy the carpet machine.

loans.use: To buy the carpet machine

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Lom Nava Spot is a place where workers and the general public have their meals and refreshments. It is operated by Madam Rebecca. She sells locally cooked foods such as banku, fufu, omo tuo and soft drinks. Demand is on the increase, and so she is asking for a loan of $800 from Kiva to enable her meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal was born in 1979 in Sumgayit. He started his business of selling clothes and other apparel items four years ago. He currently rents a small booth where he sells mainly women's clothing. Vusal is currently applying for a loan in order to expand his inventory. In the future, he plans to open his own shop.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Senanu

texts.en: Sena, as she called in her community, sells rice porridge and farm produce such as plantain, cassava and maize to people in her community. She is yearning to expand her sales. She is therefore seeking a loan of $750 from Kiva to enable her realise this dream.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Khidir

texts.en: Khidir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli. Khidir, with his family, re-settled in Sumgayit city. He is 47 years old and is married with two children. Khidir started his business of selling men's clothing four years ago. He is applying for a loan to expand his business and increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy bakes foods such as pies of different kinds, bread, doughnuts, etc., and supplies schools and the general public. The number of schools wanting her baked goods is increasing. At certain times she is unable to supply these schools because she has no money for ingredients. She is seeking a loan of $850 from Kiva to enable her meet her customer's demands. She can keep simple records on sales and as such can pay back the loan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en: Mazakhir was born in the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He is an internally displaced person (IDP). He has owned a butcher shop for the past 12 years . He is married with four children. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase more cattle and sheep as well as to buy electronic scales for use in his shop.

loans.use: To increase volume of meat and to buy electronic scales.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in a suburb of Accra in Ghana. She sells sugar, flour and rice in bags to her customers. She buys her goods direct from wholesalers and later retails them to her customers. Due to the moderate price of her goods everybody patronizes her shop. She is unable to supply them because her capital is insufficient to buy more goods. She is seeking a loan of $1100 from Kiva to enable her meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jumshud

texts.en: Jumshud was born in 1958 in Sumgait. Difficulties of life forced them to start the business. He is 49. He is the only breadwinner in the family. In the beginning he used to sell fish to restaurants. Having borrowed $300 he has bought the fishing-tackles. Jumshud applies for a $1200 loan. He plans to buy a small boat.

loans.use: He plans to buy a small boat

loans.name: Yeyevi

texts.en: Yeye is a stone cracker. She cracks stones of different sizes and sells them to constructors and individuals who want to build houses. She buys the stones for cracking from a very long distance away from her work site. She is unable to buy in large quantity due to the cost involved in buying and transporting the stones to her work site. She needs a loan of $1000 from Kiva to enable her to buy in bulk.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ninet

texts.en: S. is a market woman who sells used clothing. She buys the clothing in bales and later retails them to her community's market. Of late she is unable to go to the market to sell because she cannot buy in bales to sell. She needs assistance of $750 from Kiva to enable her to buy clothes in bales to sell.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vic lives in a small community in Accra. She journeys to a nearby town to buy dried fish of different kinds, palm fruits and oil to sell to her community. She used to buy in cartons but now she cannot because her capital is not enough. She needs a loan of $800 from Kiva to buy a large quantity of goods.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esinam

texts.en: Mama Esinam, as she is called by her customers, sells cooked kenkey, a local meal. She lives in a farming community where the farmers need an energy-giving meal early in the morning before going to their various farms. For this reason demand from her to cook in large quantity is high, but she has no capital. She is seeking a loan of $725 from Kiva to enable her cook in bulk.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Therisssa

texts.en: Madam Therissa is a stone cracker. She cracks stones of different sizes and sells to constructors and the general public. From an interview conducted with her, she said, "The cost of buying stones for cracking is very high and I need assistance to enable me buy the stones." She is therefore seeking  a loan of $1000 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 46 year old woman with 4 children. Through her own effort she has opened a mini market in front of her home. She sells everything that is needed for cooking. The community in which she lives buys from her. She has no money to buy more goods to expand her market. She is seeking a loan of $950 from Kiva to enable her supply her market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Sister Abla, as she is affectionately called by her customers, is a 36 year old woman with 3 children. She buys rice and beans in bags and cooks them for sale. Because of the increase in the cost of buying in bags which she cannot afford, she is seeking a loan of $750 from Kiva to help her buy in bags.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Madame Justine is a 37 year old woman who sells kenkey, a locally prepared meal, to her community. As the number of people in her community increases she needs to cook in larger quantity to serve her community. She has no assistance to do this. She is asking for a loan of $750 from Kiva to enable her cook in larger quantities.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mama E. has a stone-cracking site with employees who help her to crack stones in large quantities. She sells the cracked stones to constructors and individuals. She has a problem with buying stones in bulk for cracking. This has led to her employees leaving the job. She is in need and seeking a loan of $1000 from Kiva to enable her to buy more stones.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ysutor

texts.en: Y. sells items such as tomatoes, peppers, smoked fish, tinned tomatoes, corn and cassava dough, and so on. She wants to expand her sales and therefore seeks a loan of $800 from Kiva to enable her open a mini market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is a stone cracker. She sells in large quantities to constructors and individuals. She wants to buy more stones for cracking. She said, "The cost of buying stones for cracking is very expensive." She is seeking a loan of $1000 from Kiva to enable her to buy more stones. She is hardworking and capable of paying back the loan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Manaa

texts.en: Manaa is a 45 year old woman with 6 children. She cracks stones for sale. She wants to expand her business but she cannot afford to buy the stones for cracking. She is seeking a loan of $1100 from Kiva to help her expand her operations.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is a 29 year old woman who sells vegetables such as tomatoes, eggs, onions, peppers and smoked fish. She buys from wholesalers and later retails to her customers. Her dream is to open a mini market in front of her home but she has no capital. She is  seeking a loan of $800 from Kiva to enable her to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
To buy: rice, oil, vegetable, soda drinks, and kitchen utensils

para comprar: arroz, aceite, legumbres, gaseosas y utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Komayor

texts.en: B. operates a small restaurant in her locality. She sells different kinds of local meals. Her customers' demand for more meals is on the increase everyday. She wants to cook in large quantity. She is seeking a loan of $950 from Kiva to enable her cook more meals to serve her customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine has had a pharmacy for the past 7 years. She sells basic medicines and other general items. Her husband also has a store where he sells bulk medication at a bazaar. Since there was nowhere in her neighborhood to buy medication, she opened the pharmacy in her house. The business is going well and is well established at her house. She is the only one in the area that provides service 24 hours a day. Katherine has learned nursing and knows where to put bandages and give injections, and she also earns money for providing those services. She needs the loan to buy bulk medication. Katherine was born in Guayaquil and is 33 years old. She has 4 children, all of whom are studying at school. She separated from her husband 2 years ago. Her husband also helps provide for the children. She is a good worker and is always actively trying to make her life better. The separation from her husband affected her but the work has allowed her to move on. Her business has enabled her to acquire what she needs and to pay for the education of her children. She hopes to continue in a positive path and the business is her only source of income.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Zoe], Kiva Volunteer.

Katherine tiene una farmacia desde hace 7 años. Ella vende las medicinas básicas y también vende productos de bazar. El esposo de Katherine tiene un negocio de vende medicinas al por mayor en una de las bahías. En la zona donde viven no había donde comprar medicina puso en su misma casa unas pequeñas perchas. Las ventas le fue muy bien porque ahora ya tiene un lugar establecido en su misma casa. Ella es la única en su medio y atiende las 24 horas. Katherine aprendió enfermería donde también pone sueros e inyecciones y son otros ingresos que tiene. Ella actualmente necesita el préstamo para comprar medicinas al por mayor especialmente. Katherine nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 33 años. Con 4 hijos, todos están estudiando la escuela. Ella esta separada de su esposo desde hace 2 años. Su esposo si vela por las necesidades de sus hijos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora. Siempre esta activa tratando de hacer algo por mejorar su calidad de vida. Con la separación de su esposo le afecto mucho pero el trabajo le ayudo mucho ha seguir adelante. Sus negocios le han permitido tener sus bienes y poder apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios. Su deseo es seguir adelante con el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

loans.use:
The loan is needed to buy bulk medicine.

Ella actualmente necesita el préstamo para Para comprar medicinas al por mayor.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Auntie Vic sells children's wear. She buys in bulk from companies and retails to her customers. She sells from house to house but she wants to open her own babies' wear shop where she can buy more goods to sell. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 to enable her open a shop.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to buy beach clothing and shoes for the beach season

para comprar ropa playera y zapatos deportivos por la temporada

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience sells candies of various kinds. These include toffees, chocolates, biscuits, etc. She has no shop. She wants to open a shop and buy more goods. She is seeking a loan of $850 to enable her open a shop.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has been working on her business for 3 years. It is a family business where her two twin daughters and husband make the product. Elsa learned the business from her parents and they motivated her to continue working in the field. She buys the prime material from Quito every week. With the primary material she makes brooms and brushes. The business is based on the patio of her house, which is where everything is made. Her husband is responsible for delivering the products in a small second hand truck that he owns. Before she ran a store, but she had to close it in order to look after her daughters. She needs the loan in order to buy greater volumes of bristle, straw and sticks. She was born in Guayaquil and is 40 years old. She has 2 daughters. Her husband works with his truck doing deliveries. They are a humble couple, hard workers and they all work together to make the business work. Thanks to the business, they have a house and little by little they are putting down cement and making the place more suitable for the business. They have a view onto the street. She wants to keep working on the business as it is her only source of income.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Zoe], Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa tiene 3 años realizando esta actividad. Es una empresa familiar porque sus 2 hijas gemelas y su esposo son quienes elaboran el producto. Este negocio lo aprendió Elsa de sus padres. Ellos la motivaron para que también siga esta línea. Ella compra la materia prima en Quito y le llegan cada semana a la ciudad. Con eso elabora las escobas, cepillos y trape adores. El negocio esta en el patio de su casa allí elaboran el producto. Su esposo se encarga de hacer la entrega en una pequeña camioneta de segunda mano que tiene. Toda la mercadería que colocan es al contado. Anteriormente ella tenía una tienda pero tuvo que cerrar por sus hijas que no podía atenderlas. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar en mayor volumen: las cerdas de nailón, paja y palos. Elsa nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 40 años. Con 2 hijas. Su esposo trabaja en su camioneta haciendo fletes. Ambos son una pareja muy humilde, trabajadores, todos trabajan en el negocio apoyándose mutuamente. Gracias al trabajo ellos tienen su casa y poco a poco la están haciendo de cemento, a su vez están acondicionando un espacio para el negocio con vista hacia la calle. Su deseo es seguir en el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingreso segura.

loans.use:
To buy bristle, straw and sticks

para comprar: las cerdas de nailó, paja y palos.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa owns a business where she sells clothes and makeup. She has been working on this line for 5 years. Since she was young she has been dedicated to sales in order to bring some income to the family. Slowly she has raised some money that can be used for the week. She visits some zones where she knows sales will be secure. She delivers on credit and registers what is collected in her book and collects each week. From Thursday to Sunday, she does her run in the afternoon. Thanks to her income and her husbands they have been able to buy goods such as her house. She needs the loan to order and buy seasonal clothing, perfumes and makeup. Narcisa was born in Guayaquil and is 42 years old. She has 2 sons. Her husband also works as a mechanic. He provides a strong support for Narcisa. Both are responsible for the home and family. Everything they save goes towards their house which is made of cement. It is very important for Narcisa that her children are able to go to school in order to look after themselves in the future. Narcisa wants to continue to expand the business in order to increase her income.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Zoe], Kiva Volunteer.

Narcisa tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y maquillajes. Lleva 5 años vendiendo esta línea. Desde joven se ha dedicada a vender para poder llevar algún ingreso a la familia. Su capital lo fue reuniendo poco a poco a medida que su esposo le daba para la semana. Ella recorre ciertas zonas que ya las tiene definidas. Entrega a crédito y registra en su cuaderno lo que coloca, cobra cada semana. A partir del día jueves hasta el domingo sale a sus recorridos por la tarde. Gracias a los ingresos de ella y los de su esposo han podido tener su bien más importante que es su casa. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada y hacer los pedidos de perfumes y maquillaje que también coloca. Narcisa nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 42 años. Con 2 hijos. Su esposo también trabaja como mecánico. Él ha sido un apoyo para Narcisa. Ambos son muy responsable en el hogar todo ahorro ha sido para su casa que ahora ya es de cemento. Ellos han tenido que trabajar desde joven para poder subsistir. Lo más importante para Narcisa es darles los estudios a sus hijos y que puedan defenderse en el futuro. Narcisa desea crecer en su negocio y seguir generando ingresos para su hogar.

loans.use:
To buy seasonal clothing, perfumes and makeup

para comprar ropa de temporada, perfumes y maquillajes

loans.name: Carlos Norberto

texts.en:
Carlos Norberto D. holds a job as a security officer and with much effort, has succeeded in creating a video-game center to augment his earnings and the elevate his family's standard of living. He tells us that with the money he obtains from PRISMA he will be able to buy 3 Playstation 2 consoles to replace the existing ones that are in poor condition. He will also invest part of the capital in remodeling the building in order to add a bar where he can sell refreshments and other items to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Carlos Norberto D. desempeña el cargo de agente de seguridad, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado crear un centro de video juegos para incrementar sus ingresos y elevar el nivel de vida de sus familiares. Nos cuenta que con el dinero que reciba de Prisma, s.a podrá comprar 3 consolas Playstation 2 para reponer las consolas en mal estado que tiene e invertirá una parte del capital en la remodelación del local para crear un bar que le permita vender refrescos y otros productos a las personas que asistan a su negocio.

loans.use: The money obtained from PRISMA will be invested to buy 3 Playstation consoles and to remodel the building.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly has a store where she sells all kinds of food, vegetables and drinks. She started her business 2 years ago. Her mother had the store before and left it for Nelly. Nelly has been able to manage the store well. She works every day from 6am to 11pm. The store is located in a central location. She needs the loan to buy food, such as: rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, sausages, meat and chicken. Nelly was born in Guayaquil and is 21 years old. She has 2 children. She is a single mom as her husband left her. She lives with her mother who helps out all the time. Since she was young, she has always worked at the store with her mother. She knows how to run the business and wants to do well to provide for her sons. Despite her youth she is a good businesswoman ready to do well and move ahead.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Zoe], Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly tiene una tienda donde vende toda clase de víveres, legumbres y gaseosas. Ella comenzó con el negocio desde hace 2 años su madre tenía la tienda y se la dejó a ella. Nelly ha podido manejar el negocio bien. Atiende todos los días de la semana desde la 6:00AM hasta las 11:00PM. El negocio esta ubicado en una de las principales de la zona. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar los víveres como: Arroz. Azúcar, aceite, legumbres, embutidos, carnes y pollo. Nelly nació en Guayaquil. Tiene 21 años. Con 2 hijos. Ella es madre soltera su esposo la abandonó. Ella vive con su madre, quien la ha apoyado en todo momento. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar en el comedor de su madre. Sabe del negocio y piensa salir adelante especialmente por sus hijos. A pesar de su juventud se ve una persona emprendedora dispuesta a salir adelante.

loans.use:
To buy: rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, sausages, meat and chicken.

para comprar: Arroz. Azúcar, aceite, legumbres, embutidos, carnes y pollo.

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.en:
Mr.C. is a very hardworking person. He has one year of experience selling tennis shoes in an outdoor market in Nuevo Laredo and the business is growing very well, that's why he is applying for a loan of $1200.00. He wants to buy more merchandise and pay off the loan in 12 months.

El sr. C. es una persona muy trabajadora, el vende desde hace mas de un año zapatos tennis en un tiangis aqui en Nuevo Laredo y el negocio va creciendo muy bien, por lo cual el esta aplicando para un prestamo de $1200.00 dllrs y comprar mas mercancia, el planea pagarlo en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Miss T. is a very entrepreneurial person. She has one year of experience with her business selling office supplies, and she is very happy with that but she wants to grow her business and have more merchandise that will increase sales.
