Faapaia is a daughter of a Minister in the Assembly Church, and her time is committed to their youth activities. Through their youth activities, Faapaia had the idea of starting a business when they visited the market one day, and experienced other ladies doing the same business becoming really successful. She then dreamed of running a business like these ladies, and it did come true last year. Her aim is become a successful business woman that will be responsible for taking care of her youth mates and especially her parents when they retire from church. She has no intension of getting married. All she wants to do is to give back her parents the love and support they gave for her in this life.

loans.use:
Buy ingredients and materials for her pancake
business

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married and has an 8-year-old son. His father, elder brother and father-in-law are all taxi drivers so he decided to follow in their footsteps and become a taxi driver as well. His transportation business is the only source of income for his family. Vladimir is very responsible and modest and has a good reputation among other taxi drivers. He has promptly repaid each of the 11 loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. The loans have enabled him to change his vehicle 9 times in the 10-year period that he has been in business. He purchased his first car for $3,000. The last car he purchased cost $15,000. He uses an economical, diesel vehicle for his taxi and after fuel costs, he is able to bring in around $40-$50 in daily profit. Having a flexible schedule and being willing to provide transportation services all over Ukraine and to other parts of Europe have helped Vladimir get many loyal clients. Vladimir is requesting a loan of $800 to help purchase a more comfortable and reliable car. He is planning to sell his current vehicle and buy a newer Mercedes 124/300 D that is highly rated for comfort, reliability, performance, and value. A newer car will give Vladimir the opportunity to travel to other destinations, change some of his regular itineraries and expand his business. Not only will this help his business but it will also give his family a better quality of life.

Володимир – одружений, в нього є 8-річний син. Його батько, старший брат та тесть усі були водіями таксі. Отже, Володимир вирішив піти по їхніх кроках і також став таксистом. Його бізнес є єдиним джерелом прибутку для родини. Володимир – дуже відповідальний та скромний. В нього дуже гарна репутація серед інших водіїв. Володимир вчасно сплатив усі 11 позик, які він отримав від «Надії України». Позики дали йому змогу змінити 9 транспортних засобів за 10 років, на протязі яких він займається цим бізнесом. Він купив своє перше авто за 3000 доларів. Останнє коштує 15000 доларів. Володимир використовує економічне авто з дизельним двигуном, завдяки чому йому вдається щоденно заробити 40-50 доларів чистого прибутку. Гнучкий розклад та готовність подорожувати в будь-якій частині України та країнах Європи допомогли Володимиру зберегти багато відданих клієнтів. Володимир просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб придбати більш комфортабельне та надійне авто. Він планує продати своє попереднє авто та купити новіший мерседес 124/300 D, який цінується за зручність, надійність та легкість у використанні. Новіше авто надасть Володимиру можливість подорожувати в інших напрямках, змінити деякі постійні маршрути та розширити власний бізнес. До того ж це не тільки допоможе його бізнесу, але й забезпечить кращий рівень життя для його рідних.

loans.use: To buy a new comfortable Mercedes

loans.name: Fale

texts.en: Fale is a 36 year old mother with 6 kids. 2 are working, 3 are in school and 1 has been adopted by her sister. Fale has been growing vegetables while her husband worked on their taro plantation. Both of them haven’t got good educations, so weren’t able to find a jobs. They have been working on their land for many years, but weren’t able to improve due to lack of finance. It didn’t really matter to them, until their kids were all grown up and facing problems with no school fees. This encouraged Fale to search for opportunities. It’s now Fale’s 4th loan and she admits that her family is doing much better than before. She can spend and save money every week, with all her children going to school with lunch money every day. She really believes now that a healthy family is a happy family.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds, tools to be used for gardening.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two sons. In addition to her immediate family, she also takes care of her mother and father-in-law and her nephew who lives with them. Nataliya started her business because there was no other means to sustain her family. Today she runs a couple of kiosks selling bedding and knitted wear for children in the central city market. She has been in this trade for ten years. Currently, she has around $2,500 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $1,200. Nataliya is very cheerful and friendly. Her first goal is to please her customers, which has added a lot to the success of her business. Nataliya’s reasonable pricing policy helps her keep loyal clients and attract new customers. The nineteen loans she has received and repaid from “Nadiya Ukraine” have also had a big part in the growth of her business. Not long ago Nataliya was able to purchase another vending kiosk and hire a person to help her with sales. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase bed sets for children from a wholesaler. She is planning to double her assortment of inventory with warm blankets, linen sheets, pillow cases, and diapers that she can purchase in bulk. Nataliya has a couple of goals in mind for her added sales income. First, she would like to assist her nephew with his college tuition. Secondly, she is planning to use part of the income to open two new vending kiosks to sell flower seeds, plants and fertilizers during the spring season. Gardening has always been a hobby of Nataliya’s and she would like to use her knowledge and skills in this area for a new business startup.

Наталя – одружена, в неї двоє синів. Вона також дбає про своїх свекра, свекруху та племінника, який живе з ними. Наталя вирішила займатися бізнесом тому що не було інших можливостей забезпечувати родину. Зараз в неї два кіоски з продажу постільної білизни та трикотажу для дітей. Торгує Наталя на центральному міському ринку. Вона займається торгівлею вже десять років. Зараз сума її робочого капіталу становить приблизно 2500 доларів. Щомісячний прибуток складає 1200 доларів. Наталя дуже привітна та енергійна. Вона понад усе намагається догодити клієнту, це сприяє успіху її бізнесу. Помірні ціни на товари допомагають Наталі зберегти вірних клієнтів та привабити нових. Дев’ятнадцять позик, які вона отримала та сплатила в «Надії України» також позитивно відзначилися на розширенні її бізнесу. Нещодавно Наталя змогла придбати ще один кіоск та взяти на роботу ще одного реалізатора. Наталя просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб закупити комплекти постільної білизни для дітей на оптовому складі. Вона планує вдвічі збільшити асортимент ковдр, лляних простирадл, наволочок та пелюшок. Отриманий прибуток Наталя планує використати для того, щоб заплатити за навчання свого племінника в університеті. До того ж вона планує відкрити дві торгівельні точки з продажу насіння, рослин та добрив під час весняного періоду. Садівництво завжди було Наталі до душі, отже, зараз вона хотіла б використати власні знання та досвід в цій сфері для того, щоб почати новий бізнес.

loans.use: To purchase bedding for children

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is married with a teenage son. He is the only breadwinner in his family. A couple of years ago, Nikolai started a small business selling souvenirs and gifts. The business was not able to provide sufficient income to support his family, however, so Nikolai decided to try something different. Today he runs a small real estate consulting agency providing information about real estate market rates, mortgages, lending conditions and trends in the community. Nikolai has been in this business for about one year and makes around $1,000-1,500 in monthly income. Nikolai is very cheerful and client-friendly. His natural ability to make every customer feel welcome and his willingness to best serve his clients’ needs have ensured the success of his small business. One of Nikolai’s partners is a local construction company. Cooperation with this company helps him stay informed on the latest developments in the real estate market and get many new clients as a result. Nikolai has repaid four loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” which have helped to stabilize and grow his business. He would like to get a loan for $600 to print advertising leaflets for his consulting agency and to give him some additional capital for small expenses. This loan will help him promote his services and give him the opportunity to help many more people purchase homes or find good building lots for the construction of their homes. Financial assistance will give Nikolai’s business the economic boost it needs to continue to meet the needs of his customers. Nikolai is hoping that one day his hard work and determination will pay off and help him fulfill his ambitious dream of earning $1,000,000.

Микола – одружений, в нього є син підліток. Він працює в родині один. Декілька років тому Микола почав власний бізнес з продажу сувенірів та подарунків. Цей бізнес не зміг забезпечити потреби його родини. Отже, Микола вирішив спробувати власні сили в іншій сфері. Зараз в нього невеличка агенція, яка надає інформацію про ситуацію на ринку нерухомості, а саме, про ринкові ставки, заставні, умови орендування та останні тенденції у цій сфері. Микола займається цим бізнесом вже рік, щомісяця він заробляє приблизно 1000-1500 доларів прибутку. Микола – дуже жвавий та привітний з клієнтами. Його природна здатність радо прийняти кожного та готовність якомога краще обслуговувати клієнта сприяли успіху його невеличкого бізнесу. Микола співпрацює з однією місцевою будівельною компанією. Ця співпраця допомагає йому отримувати останню інформацію про зміни на ринку нерухомості, в результаті з’являється багато нових клієнтів. Микола сплатив усі чотири позики, які отримав в «Надії України». Ці кошти допомогли стабілізувати та розширити його бізнес. Микола хотів би отримати позику в 600 доларів для того, щоб надрукувати рекламні листівка для власної агенції та сплатити деякі поточні офісні витрати. Позика допоможе Миколі зробити гарну рекламу послуг, які надає його агенція, а також надасть багатьом людям можливість купити приватні будинки або знайти підходящі ділянки землі для подальшого будівництва на них. Фінансова підтримка сприятиме економічному зростанню бізнесу Миколи та допоможе йому ще краще задовольняти попит з боку нових клієнтів. Микола сподівається, що одного дня наполеглива та віддана праця все ж таки допоможе йому здійснити власну заповітну мрію та заробити 1 000 000 доларів.

loans.use: To print leaflets advertising his consulting agency

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrei is married with one daughter. After finishing his schooling he rented a small facility and started a business selling cell phones and related accessories. Later he added a selection of digital cameras which he beautifully displayed in his store along with the cell phones. Reasonable prices, an attractively designed store and customer-friendly service contributed to consistent growth in Andrei’s business. Andrei’s entrepreneurial spirit was not content to sit back however. Four years ago he decided to start a second business selling groceries. His determination and persistent work have helped him to succeed in this new area of business. Using skills and experience gained in his first business venture, Andrei has established a loyal client base attracted by his polite manner and willingness to best serve their needs. In building his business Andrei has benefited from the availability of funds through “Nadiya Ukraine”. He has maintained a perfect credit history, paying every loan back with no delinquencies. Andrei is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase food products for his grocery store. He’d like to increase his turnover capital which will allow him to buy additional merchandise and expand his second business. The ability to purchase large amounts of fresh foods and good quality grocery items will help Andrei meet the strong demand for these products. Increased business income will generate the necessary funds to meet his family’s needs and continue to grow his business.

Андрій – одружений, в нього одна донька. Після школи він орендував невеличке приміщення та почав торгувати мобільними телефонами та аксесуарами. Пізніше він також додав до своїх товарів ще й цифрові фотоапарати та гарно розташував їх на вітрині власної крамнички. Розумна цінова політика, привабливий дизайн крамниці та привітне обслуговування сприяли стабільному зростанню бізнесу Андрія. Однак, підприємницький талант Андрія мав повністю розкритися пізніше. Чотири роки потому він вирішив почати другий бізнес з продажу товарів харчування. Його наполегливість та важка праця допомогли Андрію досягти успіху й в цій новій сфері бізнесу. Завдяки ввічливій манері спілкування, бажанню якомога краще обслуговувати клієнтів та досвіду, який він отримав в сфері торгівлі мобільними телефонами, Андрій зміг знайти вірних клієнтів. Становленню його бізнесу значно сприяли кошти, отримані від «Надії України». Андрій має чудову кредитну історію, він вчасно сплатив усі позики без жодного прострочення. Андрій просить про позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб закупити харчі для своєї крамнички. Він хотів би збільшити робочий капітал, що, в свою чергу, допоможе йому закупити більше товару та розширити свій другий бізнес. Можливість закупити більшу кількість свіжих харчів та якісних продовольчих товарів допоможе Андрію задовольнити зростаючий попит на ці продукти. Збільшення прибутків допоможе йому отримати необхідні кошти для того, щоб задовольнити потреби родини та надалі розширювати власний бізнес.

loans.use: To increase inventory for food store

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married with two grown children. Two years ago she was facing some serious challenges with her clothing sales business. Low sales rates, few customers, and an inconvenient location for her vending kiosk all contributed to poor performance. However, Anna didn’t give up. After hearing about lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” she decided to get a loan and move into a new area of business. Today, Anna runs three kiosks selling clothing, bed linens, towels, terrycloth fabric, textiles, etc. Her daughter is actively involved in the business, helping her mom with sales. Anna has proven to be a hard-working, dedicated entrepreneur and runs her business with integrity and innovation. She doesn’t hesitate when taking risks, which has helped her to succeed despite serious competition in the market. Presently, Anna has about $3,000 in working capital and her monthly net profit amounts to $1,000. Anna is requesting a loan of $1,200 to help open an additional small store selling bedding and linens in the local mall. She would like to purchase cotton, flannel and micro-fiber sheet sets, blankets, towels, and linens at wholesale prices to sell in the new location. This loan will help her to expand her business and will have a positive impact on her trade profitability, helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

Анна – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Два роки потому в неї виникли серйозні труднощі у торгівлі одягом, якою вона займалася. Низькі показники продажів, небагато покупців та незручне розташування її торгового місця лише погіршували й без того погане становище Анни. Однак, Анна не здавалася. Після того, як вона почула про кредитні послуги, які надає «Надія України» вона вирішила скористатися фінансовою підтримкою та спробувати себе в іншій сфері торгівлі. Зараз в Анни три кіоски з продажу одягу, постільної білизни, халатів, рушників, тканин тощо. Її донька активно допомагає матері з бізнесом. Анна зарекомендувала себе як працьовитий, відданий власній справі підприємець. Вона – дуже чесна людина, завжди намагається бути новатором у роботі. Анна не боїться ризикувати, що й допомогло їй досягти успіху, не дивлячись на серйозну конкуренцію на ринку. Зараз в Анни приблизно 3000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток становить 1000доларів. Анна просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб відкрити ще одну невеличку крамничку з продажу білизни та тканин в місцевому торгівельному центрі. Вона хотіла б придбати бавовняні, фланельні комплекти простирадл, ковдри, рушники та лляні тканини за оптовими цінами для подальшого роздрібного продажу. Позика сприятиме розвитку торгівлі та позитивно відіб’ється на прибутковості бізнесу Анни, що, в свою чергу, допоможе покращити економічне та соціальне становище її родини.

loans.use: To open a small store selling bed linens in the local mall

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a teenage son. In post-Soviet times many families in Ukraine struggled to meet their basic needs. Tatyana’s family was no exception. She decided to start her own business selling groceries to help provide for her family during those tough times. Some of the first loans Tatyana received from “Nadiya Ukraine” were very small. She was able to maintain a perfect credit history and gradually could borrow greater amounts as her business grew. With time her hard work and determination paid off and Tatyana began to witness rapid growth in sales and the expansion of her business. Eventually she was able to open a new kiosk selling clothing and women’s lingerie and hired people to help her with sales. Currently, Tatyana has about $1,200 in monthly net profit. Tatyana is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more stock to sell in her women’s clothing and lingerie store. She would like to purchase assorted sweaters, skirts, blouses, and good quality underwear to meet growing demand from her customers. The loan will help Tatyana strengthen her trade activities and provide necessary resources for her business and family.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї є син підліток. В пострадянські часи багатьом родинам довелося зіткнутися з численними побутовими труднощами. Родина Тетяни не стала винятком. Отже, Тетяна вирішила почати власний бізнес з продажу товарів харчування для того, щоб забезпечити себе й рідних в ті скрутні часи. Перші позики, які Тетяна отримала від «Надії України» були зовсім невеличкими. Її кредитна історія була чудовою, отже, вона змогла отримати більші за розміром позики. З часом її наполеглива праця та цілеспрямованість принесли свої результати. Бізнес Тетяни швидко зростав та обсяги продажів ставали дедалі більшими. Врешті-решт вона змогла відкрити новий кіоск з продажу жіночого одягу та білизни та взяти на роботу реалі- заторів. Сьогодні Тетяна заробляє приблизно 1200 доларів чистого прибутку щомісяця. Тетяна просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати більше одиниць жіночого одягу та білизни. Вона планує придбати светри, спідниці, блузи та якісну білизну для того, щоб задовольнити зростаючий попит своїх клієнтів. Позика допоможе Тетяні зміцнити торгівлю та забезпечить необхідні ресурси для родини та бізнесу.

loans.use: To increase clothing stock

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with one daughter and is the only breadwinner in his family. He runs a small business selling auto parts in one of the local markets in Berdyansk. A convenient location for his kiosk and a good variety of available inventory has contributed to the success of his business. Yuryi is a very committed entrepreneur. His reputation for selling quality parts and knowledge of his customer’s preferences has helped him keep loyal clientele and promoted stable growth for his business. His gross monthly revenue currently amounts to around $3,000. Yuryi is requesting a loan of $500 to help open a second vending kiosk selling auto parts. He is planning to purchase a variety of engine, electrical, suspension, brake, transmission and steering parts to stock in the new kiosk and help meet customer demand for these products. All of the parts, designed and made using high end technology, will be good quality and will help attract many potential customers and auto lovers to Yuryi’s store.

Юрій – одружений, в нього одна дочка. Він один працює з родини. В Юрія бізнес з продажу автозапчастин на місцевих ринках міста Бердянськ. Зручне розташування його кіоску та широкий вибір товарів сприяли успішному зростанню його бізнесу. Юрій – дуже відданий підприємець. Його чудова репутація та розуміння побажань покупців допомогли йому зберегти вірних клієнтів та сприяли стабільному зростанню його бізнесу. Загальний сума доходів Юрія щомісяця складає приблизно 3000 доларів. Юрій просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб відкрити другу торгівельну точку з продажу автозапчастин. Він планує закупити різноманітні запчастини для моторів, підвісок, гальм, коробки передач тощо для того, щоб задовольнити попит клієнтів на ці товари. Усі ці високоякісні запчастини, розроблені згідно з новітніми технологіями, допоможуть привабити потенційних покупців та автолюбителів до крамниці Юрія.

loans.use: To open a new vending kiosk selling auto parts

loans.name: Gaupule

texts.en: Gaupule is a 49 year old mother of 6 daughters, all grown up and married with kids. They’re all in Samoa with 2 of them still living together with her and 4 living on their own at different villages. Gaupule’s talent was been taught to her by her mother, and she’s now passing it on to her two daughter staying together with her. Gaupule has introduced some new creative ideas to her business, by adding names on her bags, flowers and tapa prints. She can make different types of bags, from square, rectangular, oval, heart shaped and much more in desired sizes to suit their shapes. Her regular customers are gift shops, hotels and flea market owners. Gaupule admits that her business may have good markets, but she still needs the modern tools to make the job fast and time. With her requested loan, she plans to take her business up to another level, not just by selling them to her customers for the public, but she will be selling themdirectly to the public at a very affordable price.

loans.use: To purchase materials -- pandanus leaves, weaving equipment, dyes, paints, feathers, and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to relocate her grocery business to a safe environment and purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her general business stall and expand her stock (cereals, mobile airtime cards, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials, packaging and transport

loans.name: Rébecca

texts.en:
Rébecca L. A., 33, is a typist by profession with a 12th grade education. She has worked as a saleswoman and cashier in the PMU section of the Togo National Lottery, but she lost her position following the premature birth of her second child, who arrive only six months after her first child was born. A $200 loan allowed her to make ends meet. She takes care of several people: two children, seven others, and her husband who grieves and suffers along with her.

She is requesting a loan of $1,200 that she intends to repay in 12 months. The loan will serve to build up a significant stock of goods for her grocery store, thus strengthening her business efforts. This woman is very energetic and a very disciplined manager who deserves support.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Opératrice de saisie avec le niveau terminale, L. A. Rébecca, 33 ans, a travaillé à la loterie nationale togolaise section PMU comme vendeuse et caissière. Elle perdu son emploi à la suite d’une deuxième grossesse trop rapprochée, six mois seulement après la naissance du premier enfant. C’est grâce à un petit crédit de $200 qui lui a permis de joindre les bouts. Elle a de nombreuses personnes à charges : sept personnes en plus des deux enfants et de son mari qui non plus n’est pas au bout de ses peines.

Pour renforcer ses activités commerciales, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 qu’elle se propose de rembourser en 12 mois. Cet appui financier servira à constituer un stock important de marchandises pour sa boutique d’alimentation générale. C’est une femme très dynamique et une gestionnaire très rigoureuse qui mérite d’être soutenue.

loans.use: Grocery business

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.en:
Adjoavi A. was born in Agoè (Golfe prefecture) in 1960. She grows crops and lives off the earth. She is married and the mother of five who manages to help with family expenses with the produce from her fields. This produce is a major source of income. Through her energy and mastery of farming, she has been able to repay her loans on time.

She is currently requesting a new loan of $750 to expand the area for cultivation and thus to increase her production of corn and cassava. This is how she hopes to have sufficient income to help improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1960 à Agoè (P/Golfe), Madame A. Adjoavi est une femme cultivatrice qui vit de la terre. Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle arrive à partager les dépenses de son foyer grâce aux produits de son champ qui lui procurent d’importants revenus. Par le dynamisme et la maîtrise de ses activités champêtres, elle a su rembourser ses crédits au moment convenu. A présent elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir sa superficie cultivée et par conséquent augmenter sa production de maïs et du manioc. Ainsi, compte t-elle avoir de moyens suffisants pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Growing corn and cassava

loans.name: Kodjo Alexis

texts.en:
Kodjo Alexis M. is about 42 years old, has two wives, seven children, and takes care of four others in his family. He is an itinerant photographer by trade. As a father of a large family, he is very poor and has been unable to meet the needs of his family, particularly regarding the schooling of his children despite all his efforts each day. He has benefited from a few small loans, which he has by the way repaid without incident. His finicky camera is a major handicap, as is a lack of means of communication, when facing his competition.

To solve these problems, he is presently requesting a loan of $1,200 to acquire a new, quality camera and to open his own studio. Given his record for paying back his previous loans, his offer to repay this new loan in 12 months seems doable to us.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 42 ans environ, M. Kodjo Alexis est époux de deux femmes, sept enfants et quatre autres personnes à sa charge. Il est photographe ambulant de métier. C’est donc un père de famille nombreuse, très pauvre et qui n’arrive pas à faire face aux charges de sa famille et surtout à la scolarisation de ses enfants, malgré tous ses efforts quotidiens. Il a eu à bénéficier de quelques petits crédits de soutiens qu’il a d’ailleurs bien remboursés. La qualité quelque peu défectueuse de son appareil photo et le manque de moyen de communication l’handicape beaucoup à tenir face à la concurrence. Pour y remédier, il sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1200 pour se procurer de nouvel appareil photo de qualité et ouvrir son propre studio. Eu égard à son comportement exemplaire pour le remboursement des crédits antérieurs, sa proposition de rembourser ce nouveau crédit en 12 mois nous parait réalisable.

loans.use: To buy a new, quality camera and to open his own photo studio

loans.name: Komla

texts.en:
Soon aged 45, Komla A., reseller of construction gravel for nearly ten years is married to two women and father to five children and six others who he supports.  His work has not had great success in times past due to his not owning his own truck.  He has worked up to this point for the truck owners who set the prices themselves.  To improve his situation, he has received a small credit of $400USD which he has already paid back despite his numerous family responibilities. 

Mr. A. is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy a truck with which he will transport gravel thereby setting his own transport fees. He plans to repay this loan in 15 months.  This is a man with ample experience in this field of work and on who has previously demonstrated both his expertise as a driver as well as his business experience and reliability.

loans.use: Purchase of a gravel truck

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Born in 1974, Mr. Komlan KOUEGNEOUGAN quit school in the 9th grade.  He is married to Abra GAGNON who is a retailer of general merchandise, Komlan is father to one child and has five others whom he supports. Mr. KOUEGNEOUGAN is a retailer of a local soft drink made of palm extract.  He has acquired ample experience in the field and has a reputation of repaying his debts on time.  

By his desire to make his business more profitable to improve the quality of life for his family, he is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a large stock of the beverage at a lowered price, thus increasing his profits.

loans.use: To Purchase Sodabi Soft Drink inventory

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en: Kossiwa L. is an exceptionally hard-working illiterate woman of 48 years of age.  She is married and is mother to 8 children.  Her husband is a poor peasant with no means of reliable income.  Kossiwa sells produce of all kinds, specializing in dried red hot chili peppers (yes, red hot chili peppers! [piments]. This industry thrives during periods of drought or between rainy seasons.  The areas where the peppers are grown is far from her home. She is asking for $1200 in order for her to buy at a quantity discount and sell at a greater profit.  She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase, Stock and Sale of RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS!

loans.name: Massan

texts.en: Mrs. Massan A. was born in 1959.  She is married to a poor farmer and has two children and takes care of two other children.  Her family situation requires her to be a major contributor to the household income.  She is asking for a loan of $750 to increase the profits of her already modestly successful business.  This new loan will bring in additional revenues which will improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: Purchase rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fit in the seatbelts in the public service vehicle

loans.name: Kudura

texts.en:
Kudura Y. is a very active 56-year-old. He has three wives and eleven children. He has trouble supporting everyone that he is responsible for. This is because he works at nothing else but growing vegetables, which include tomatoes and peppers. Each of his wives takes care of their children the best they can.

This situation, which has always kept this gentleman pre-occupied, is leading him to commit himself to a little better farming. And so he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorized pump. He can then avoid the hazards of poor weather. The loan will also go towards a bug sprayer for protecting his crops. He has a lot of experience in his field of endeavor. And as a plus, he has arable land along the Zio river.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Très actif à 56 ans, Y. Kudura est marié à trois (03) femmes et est père de onze (11) enfants. Il a du mal à supporter sa charge familiale, car n’ayant autre activité que la culture des légumineuses entre autre tomate et piment. Chaque femme s’occupe comme elles le peuvent de leurs enfants. Cette situation qui a toujours indisposé ce monsieur, l’amènera à s’engager dans une agriculture légèrement améliorée. Ainsi donc, Il sollicite $1200 pour l’achat d’une moto pompe afin de ne plus être soumis aux aléas (hazards/dangers) climatiques et un pulvérisateur pour désinfecter les cultures contre les parasites. Il a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine et a un atout favorable d’avoir ses espaces cultivables au bord du fleuve Zio.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorized pump

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials and grocery stock to expand her business

loans.name: Akoélévi

texts.en: Born in 1971 in Fongbe Apedome (Zio Province) Mrs. Akoelevi LIASSADJI  left school in elementary school.  Since then she has sold donuts (beignets) along the main autoroutes in her area.  She is married and has two children and cares for two other persons. Her family lives near the absolute poverty level, her husband contributing very little to the family income.  Her exceptional managerial capabilities and the skill level at which she runs her small business will allow her to repay her loan of $750 within the scheduled time frame.  Such an opportunity will enable her to get out of her and her family's dire circumstances.

loans.use: Bulk discount purchase of wheat flour and cooking oil (Achat de sacs de farine de blé et des bidons d’huile)

loans.name: Sovissi

texts.en:
40 years old, Mrs. Sovissi A. is married and mother of two children.  She contributes to the family revenues by selling prepared bean-based meals.  This is a flourishing sector of the food industry but the financial means of Sovissi does not allow her to satisfy all of her clientele.

Having already fulfilled a loan previously she is now asking for a new loan of $750 to more efficiently profit from her business and thereby improving the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of beans, cooking oil and canned food.  (Achat des sacs de haricot, des bidons d’huile des boîtes de conserves)

loans.name: Yiéli

texts.en:
Yiéli K. is a young man of 29, married, has one child, and is responsible for two others. After finishing grade school, he chose to pursue agriculture, but the difficulty of manual labor did not allow him to fully enjoy his work. His tools were quite rudimentary and thus dampened his goals and ambitions.

The resources at his disposal do not allow him to save money that could allow significant borrowing. And so he is requesting financing of $1,200 to buy a motorized pump and plow and to buy soil amendments. This young man, brimming with courage and energy, is offering to repay this financing in 18 months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Jeune homme de 29 ans, K. Yiéli est marié et père d’un enfant et de deux (02) autres personnes à sa charge. Ayant arrêté ses études après le cours primaire, il a choisi l’agriculture mais la dureté du travail manuel ne lui permet pas de jouir pleinement de son travail. Ces outils sont très rudimentaires réduisant ses objectifs et ses ambitions.

Les ressources qu’il dispose, ne lui permettent pas d’effectuer des épargnes pouvant lui permettre d’accéder à un crédit conséquent. C’est pourquoi, il sollicite un financement de $1200 d’une moto pompe et une moto cultivatrice pour les billons et pour l’achat des intrants. Ce jeune homme plein de courage et de dynamisme propose de rembourser ce financement en 18 mois.

loans.use: To buy motorized pump, a motorized plow, and soil amendments

loans.name: Eya

texts.en:
Eya D. is 47, married, and the mother of four. The needs of this family are soaring, but satisfying them is necessary for its welfare. This is why Ms. D. started selling porridge with the help of a loan from Microfund Togo. Given her good ability to manage, she has been able to repay the loan on time. And recognizing her own energy and mastery of her business, she has decided to increase her number of income streams in order to elevate her family once more.

And so she is requesting a loan of $750 to ensure that she can acquire palm nuts and produce red palm oil out of them. With this new business activity, she believes she can help improve the living conditions of her family even more.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 47 ans, Madame D. Eya est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Les besoins de cette famille sont si croissants mais nécessaires à satisfaire pour son bien être. C’est ainsi que Madame D. Eya s’est lancée dans la vente de la bouillie et après un crédit auprès de la MICROFUND. Par sa bonne capacité de bien gérer ses activités elle a su rembourser au moment opportun. Reconnaissant son dynamisme et la maîtrise de ses activités, elle décide multiplier ses sources de revenus pour relever le niveau de sa famille.

Ainsi, sollicite t-elle encore un crédit de $750 afin d’assurer l’achat et la transformation de la noix de palme en huile rouge. Elle pense pouvoir contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille par cette nouvelle activité.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and make palm oil

loans.name: Sofansi

texts.en:
Sofansi H. is 49, a widow, and the mother of seven. Her business is agricultural in nature, and she sells gari (cassava flour) to provide for her family. With her devotion and especially her good business management, she was able to repay her previous loans without a problem.

Presently, she is requesting a loan of $650 to grow her business. The loan will make this transformation more worthwhile and will maximize her income, all to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 49 ans, Madame H. Sofansi est veuve et mère de sept (07) enfants. Elle exerce les activités agricoles, et la vente de gari (farine de manioc) pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Par son dévouement et surtout sa bonne gestion des activités, elle a su solder les antécédents crédits sans incidents.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour augmenter la taille de ses activités afin de pouvoir plus rentabiliser cette transformation et avoir le revenu maximum pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cassava

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Kossi H. is 43, monogamous, and the father of eight. He is also responsible for three others. He embraced his main business of agriculture after finishing grade school. It's a difficult way to make a living because of the rudimentary level of farming and especially because of the problem with water. Due to the rarity of rain, seven months out of twelve are months of shortages.

To solve his problems, particularly with regards to growing vegetables such as peppers and tomatoes, he often turns to renting motorized pumps. To be able to operate completely independently and with the means to do so, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to be repaid in 12 months. The loan would be for acquiring his own motorized pump and an automatic irrigation system.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monogame, H. Kossi, âgé de 43 ans, est père de huit (08) enfants et de trois (03) autres personnes à sa charge. Il a pour activité principale l’agriculture qu’il a embrassée après ses études primaires. Ce métier est très difficile pour son caractère rudimentaire et surtout à cause du problème d’eau. Sept mois sur douze sont des mois de soudure à cause de la rareté de la pluie en ces périodes.

Pour s’en sortir surtout avec la culture des légumineuses tels que les piments et les tomates, il a souvent recours à la location des motos pompes. Pour travailler en toute indépendance et avec plus de moyens, il sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1000 à rembourser en 12 mois pour s’acheter une moto pompe et un système d’arrosage automatique.

loans.use: To buy a motorized pump and an automatic irrigation system

loans.name: Akuyo

texts.en:
Akuyo A. is 45 years old woman, a very poor widow without the means to take care of her nine children all by herself. These children can be found here and there, they lack education, and they are in need of clean blankets. What she must endure has lead her to think that another marriage would be a better solution to her problems. And so she got engaged to a man who already has ten children, and this only served to overwhelm her more.

Two previous loans have allowed her to pursue several things, including commerce in gari (granulated cassava root) and in various products. She is presently requesting a loan of $800 to establish herself and to diversify her business selling grocery items. This woman, with all her problems, manages somehow to figure out a way by using her courage and especially her entrepreneurial spirit. She truly deserves support.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 45 ans, Mme A. Akuyo est veuve mère de neuf (09) enfants et a à sa seule charge tous les enfants. Très pauvre et n’ayant pas les moyens pour faire face à ces obligations, tous les enfants sont dispersés un peu partout sans éducation et ne bénéficient d’aucune couverture sanitaire. Les difficultés qu’elle endure lui ont fait penser qu’un autre mariage lui apporterait meilleure solution. Elle s’est alors engagée avec un autre homme qui a déjà dix (10) enfants. C’était pour se faire noyer davantage.

Ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits qui lui sont permis d’entreprendre beaucoup de chose, entre autre la vente de gari (manioc transformé) et la vente des produits divers, elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 pour s’installer et diversifier son commerce de l’alimentation générale. Cette femme, avec tous les problèmes qu’elle endure arrive tant bien que mal à s’en sortir grâce à son courage et surtout à son esprit d’entreprendre, mérite vraiment un appui.

loans.use: To sell grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheat and green bananas inventory and upgrade her grocery business

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en:
Mr V. Kokou was born in 1985 in Tsevie. He quit school at an early age, but he earned his driver's license thanks to the good will and aid of others. As he lacks the means to buy a automobile, he has decided to buy a motorcycle instead. There is plenty of work to be found, on condition that one has transportation, such as a motorcycle. He is accomplished in his driving skills, and asks for a loan of $800.00, which will allow him to buy a motorcycle and to find work in order to help his parents and to better their current living conditions.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Monsieur V. Kokou est né en 1985 à Tsévié. Abandonnant très tôt ses études, il a pu avoir son permis de conduire grâce à des gens de bonne volonté qui l’ont aidé. Par manque de moyens pour acheter un véhicule il opte pour la conduite de moto. C’est un travail très florissant à condition que tu as ta propre moto. Maîtrisant bien son métier, il sollicite un crédit de $800, qui servira à l’achat d’une moto afin de mieux rentabiliser ses affaires pour pouvoir contribuer d’avantage à l’amélioration des conditions de ses parents.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.en:
At 45 years old, Mrs S. Ameyo is the only caretaker for seven children out of the thirteen her husband has with his polygamous wives, and whose husband is currently unemployed as well. The main source of income for the family is the sales of manioc(cassava root) flour, and a source of income with too much instability to assure the education of the children. Mrs Ameyo's work, preparing the manioc paste is very difficult. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan of $1,000.00 in order to buy a rough mill that will be able to be used by other women in her area as well. The loan will also be used to buy some manioc fields from the farmers, who have large fields. She proposes repaying the loan in 12 months. The loan will have a positive impact in her economic activities but above all, the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Agée de 45 ans ; Madame S. Améyo a à sa seule charge sept (07) enfants sur les treize enfants de son mari polygame et sans emploi. La source de revenu de cette femme est la vente de farine de manioc, une ressource très insuffisante pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Ce métier de tonification de la pâte de manioc en gari est très difficile. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit $1000 pour s’acheter un moulin râpeuse qui sera aussi très utile pour les femmes de sa localité. Ce crédit servira également à s’acheter des champs de manioc auprès des agriculteurs qui ont de grands champs. Elle se propose de rembourser ce crédit en 12 mois. Ce financement aura un impact positif sur son activité commerciale et surtout sur l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie familiale.

loans.use: To purchase a rough mill.

loans.name: Kébidou

texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Nigeria, Mr A. Kebidou is married and father of five children. He works selling brochette and is his main source of income, which allows him to provide for his family and their needs. His practice of good hygiene and his expertise has made him a favored merchant of all the local inhabitants of his neighborhood. He has 2 active loans which he keeps in good balance. To expand his business he needs to buy animals and chicken meat, so he is asking for another loan of $650.00, which will enable him to increase his earnings and to contribute more to the improvement of his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Né en 1966 au Nigéria, Monsieur A. Kébidou est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il exerce comme activité de vente de brochette qui constitue sa source de revenu et lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Sa bonne pratique de l’hygiène et sa maîtrise fait de lui un bon vendeur aimé de tous les habitants de sa localité. Il compte actif 2 crédits qui ont été bien soldés. Pour pouvoir renforcer son activité de vente par l’achat d’animaux et de poulets de chair, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $650 qui pourra le procurer d’importants revenus afin de contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase animals and chicken meat.

loans.name: Wotoe

texts.en:
At 37 years old, Ms S. Wotoe is an illiterate mother of seven children, in a polygamous family. All of her children are entirely under her care and she would not be able to care for them as she does if it were not for the aid of the Catholic Sisters who educate the children, including the triplets. Thanks to the small loans, she has gotten a taste for small business and the results of various supports she receives. She sells bread as well as grilled fish. Currently, she has the ambition to add to her fish sales that of selling condiments, so that at her place her customers can find all they need for their meal. It is for this that she is asking for a loan of $1,200.00 that will be repayed over a period of 12 months, which will allow her to increase her number of customers and to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Agée de 37 ans, Madame S. Wotoe est une femme analphabète mère de sept (07) enfants dans un foyer polygame. Tous ses enfants sont abandonnés à sa charge et elle n’arrive à s’en sortir péniblement que grâce aux aides que lui apportent les sœurs catholiques pour la scolarité de ses enfants surtout pour ses triplés. Mais grâce aux petits crédits, elle a pris goût à la micro entreprise et surtout à la suite de diverses formations de renforcement de capacité qu’elle a reçues. Elle vend du pain et surtout du poisson grillé. Aujourd’hui, elle nourrit beaucoup d’ambitions en voulant ajouter au commerce du poisson des condiments de façon que, chez elle seule, le client arrive à trouver tout pour faire la cuisine. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 à rembourser en 12 mois afin de lui permettre d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase and resell fish and condiments.

loans.name: Kossi T.

texts.en:
Born in 1967, Mr. Kossi T. M. is married and father of one child. He is a mechanic by trade, although he makes very little in this profession. He has changed his career focus and is now a vulcanizer. Mr. M. is finally starting to turn a small profit thanks to this change in careers. He is honest and is a good risk to the loan. He is asking for a loan of $800 which will allow him to buy chemicals and equipment needed in the vulcanization process. Through this loan he will be able to improve the quality of life of his family.

Translated from French by David Pigott, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1967 Monsieur M. T. Kossi est marié et père d’un enfant. Mécanicien de profession, il constate que ce métier lui remportait peu de bénéfice. Alors il changea de spécialité et devient vulcanisateur et il arrive subvenir aux besoins exprimés grâce aux revenus que lui procure son métier. Honnête, il fait preuve d’une bonne gestion de ses activités. Il sollicite un crédit de $800 qui servira à l’achat de certains matériels de vulcanisation. Il pourra ainsi contribuer efficacement à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of rubber vulcanization materials.

loans.name: Awagasi

texts.en:
A woman of 35 years, with five children, Ms G. Awagasi is an illiterate women who specializes in traditional healing, the secret to her profession is the knowledge of pharmaceutical herbs that she inherited from her parents. Many of these herbs are not found where she lives. She must travel very far , sometimes for hours outside the country to find what she needs. This is why she is asking for a loan for $600.00 which will be re payed over twelve months. She has shown herself to be very dynamic and strong, and has proved herself responsible with her re-payments of previous loans.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

eune femme de 35 ans avec cinq (05) enfants, Madame G. Awagasi est une femme illettrée spécialisée dans la pharmacopée traditionnelle, le secret de la vertu pharmaceutique des herbes qu’elle a hérité e ses parents. Beaucoup de ses herbes ne se trouvent pas sur place. Il faut voyager très loin quelques fois hors du pays pour s’en procurer. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $600 à rembourser en 12 mois. Signalons qu’elle est très dynamique et rigoureuse et a toujours fait preuve d’un très bon comportement lors du remboursement de ses crédits antérieurs.

loans.use: The sales of traditional pharmaceutical herbs.

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi A. was born in 1964 in Tsévié. He is married and supports five other people. His main activity is to repair electronic equipment [such as television, radio, speakers]in order to pay for cleaning expenses at home. He is a dynamic man that manages his business very well and has, on numerous occasions, proven his honesty by repaying loans. His workshop is frequented by many clients. At this time, he is asking for a credit of $900 in order to modernize his workshop, purchase new things to benefit his work and enable him to contribute more to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komi est né en 1964 à Tsévié. Marié, il a cinq (05) personnes à charge. Son activité principale est la réparation d’appareils électriques (tels que la télévision, la radio, les amplificateurs et autres) pour subvenir aux dépenses du ménage. C’est un homme dynamique maîtrisant bien son métier et qui a plusieurs fois fait preuve d’honnête dans les remboursements de ses crédits. Son atelier est très fréquenté par beaucoup de clients. Il sollicite alors un nouveau crédit de $900 qui pourra le permettre de moderniser son atelier, faire de nouveaux achats afin de mieux rentabiliser ses affaires pour contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Aged 47, Mrs. Ablavi N. is the fourth wife of her husband and his a mother of six children of the total 18 children her husband has. In this home, the husband is poor, without a job and virtually absent. Therefore, the wives must support the husband and the children. This situation explains the children's flawed education. She has varied jobs but running a restaurant is her principal activity. This work is not advantageous because there are many moutsh to feed in their family. This is why she is asking for a loan of $1000 to reimburse in 12 months in order to diversify her activities by adding general food products and selling cereal at the big market during high traffic days.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 47 ans, Madame N. Ablavi est la quatrième femme de son mari et est mère de six (06) enfants sur les dix huit que compte son mari. Dans ce foyer, le mari pauvre et sans emploi est virtuellement absent. Ce sont donc les femmes qui supportent le mari et les enfants. Une situation qui explique la scolarisation très défectueuse des enfants. Elle mène diverses activités mais la restauration en est la principale. Ce travail ne l’avantage pas beaucoup parce que les bouches à nourrir dans sa famille sont trop nombreuses. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit consistant de $1000 à rembourser en 12 mois pour diversifier ses activités en y ajoutant de l’alimentation générale et la vente des céréales les grands jours de marché.

loans.use: Expand her restaurant

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Aged approximately 40 years old, Mr. Komi A. is maried and a father of seven children. Abandoning his studies, he quickly became an apprentice in bricklaying. He also raises local chickens in order to provide for his family's needs.

Very active, he is planning to multiply and strengthen his revenue sources by a loan of $750 which would allow him to buy a better breed of local chicken as well as products to treat these chicken when they become sick. With the profits he is already envisioning, he is hoping to contribute more to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 40 ans environs, Monsieur A. Komi est marié et père de sept (07) enfants. Abandonnant ses études, il s’est vite lancé dans l’apprentissage de la maçonnerie. Il associé à son métier l’agriculture et l’éleveur traditionnel des poules locales pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Très actif, dans ses affaires, il compte multiplier et renforcer ses sources de revenus par un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’achat des poules locales et de race améliorée ainsi que les produits de traitement d’éventuelle maladie. Par ces revenus qui pointent déjà à l’horizon, il espère contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy a better breed of local chickens and improve their care

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
At only 24 years old, Mrs. Yawa K. is a mother of two children in a polygamous home that has a total of seven children. Polygamy is very disadvantageous for women and their children in this area. The woman must struggle to education her children and attend to their primary needs. This is why this young woman, which a job that differs greatly from the other women, sells clothes and under garments for children and adolescents. In order to improve her business and increase her profits, she is asking for $600. This loan will allow her to expand her business to other zones and gain additional clients at the big markets in her region.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

A 24 ans seulement, Madame K. Yawa est mère de deux (02) enfants dans un foyer polygame de sept (07) enfants. La polygamie est très désavantageuse pour les femmes et les enfants de cette localité. C’est la femme elle-même qui doit se battre pour scolariser ses enfants et subvenir à leurs besoins primaires. Voilà pourquoi cette jeune fille, avec une activité très différente de celle d’autres femmes, fait le commerce de la vente d’habits et de caleçons pour enfants et adolescents. En vue d’améliorer son activité et accroître son chiffre d’affaires, elle demande $600. Ce financement va lui permettre d’étendre ses activités à d’autres zones et à d’autres clients des grands marchés de sa région.

loans.use: Selling clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase modern tailoring equipment and higher quality fabrics to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Koubahoin

texts.en:
At 36, Ms T. Koubahoin, never had the chance to go to school. Married to a farmer, she is the mother of seven children. To contribute to the payment of household expenses, she has began to produce palm oil, which has proven to be a great success. Because of good management of her activities, she has been able to pay back previous loans without any difficulties. Now, in order to increase her sales, Ms T. Koubahoin is asking for a loan of $550.00, to buy palm nuts and make them into oil. With this new loan, which is an important source of revenue, she hopes to better to living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Agée de 36 ans environs, Madame T. Koubahoin n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle est mère de sept (07) enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins du foyer, cette mère s’est lancée dans production de l’huile de palme qu’elle exerce avec un grand succès. Par la bonne gestion de ses activités, elle a remboursé ses antécédents crédits sans difficultés. Ainsi pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, Madame T. Koubahoin sollicite à présent un crédit de $550 pour assurer l’achat et la transformation de la noix de palme en huile. Avec ce nouveau crédit qui est source d’importants revenus, elle pense améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts to make into red oil.

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.en:
Akoélé S. was born in Fongbé (in Zio prefecture) in 1949. She was not fortunate enough to go to school. Nevertheless, she is in business selling sodabi (a local drink distilled from palm trees) which allows her to help her husband to provide for her family. Her husband is employed at a local company. She has six children and is responsible for one other person. This is a woman who sets a fine example caring for the her children’s well-being. With shrinking profits, she is requesting a new loans of $850 to strengthen her business and to cover a significantly larger portion of household expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1949 à Fongbé (P/Zio) Madame S. Akoélé n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Néanmoins elle exerce comme activité la de vente de sodabi (boisson locale extrait du palmier) qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille en plus de la contribution de son mari, un employé dans une société de la place. Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, elle a à sa charge une autre personne. Madame S. Akoélé est une femme exemplaire qui se souci du bien être de ses enfants. Partant de la rentabilité de son activité, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $850 pour renforcer son commerce et participer plus significativement aux dépenses du foyer.

loans.use: Commerce in sodabi

loans.name: Amé

texts.en:
At 47, Madame G. Ame is married and the mother of seven children. Despite not having any formal schooling, she has launched into the business of grains and traditional soaps. She has a natural feel for business and takes advantage of business opportunities as they arise, and wishes to expand her business activities outside her neighborhood in order to increase her earnings. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan of $800.00 so that she can travel to different grain production zones and search for more better bargains.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 47 ans, Madame G. Amé est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. N’ayant aucun cursus scolaire, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréale et des savons traditionnels. Ayant pris du goût à l’identification des occasions entreprenariales suite aux multiples formations en matière de renforcement de capacité, elle a voulu à tout prix mener ses activités aussi au-delà de la localité afin d’améliorer ses revenus. Voilà pourquoi elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 pour aller jusque dans les zones de production des céréales et s’approvisionner à des coûts mieux rentables.

loans.use: Purchase and sales of grains.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina Luis S., 35 years of age and a native of Maputo, grew up with her mother. For their survival, her mother dedicated herself to small businesses that allowed Amina to study until the 4th grade. After 18 years, Amina emigrated to neighboring South Africa. Having returned after 2 years with funds she had saved in South Africa, she opened a small grocery store. A single mother, she is responsible for a family of four, three of which include her children. With the loan she intends to increase the volume of her business and to provide diverse products to her customers. Her business has a positive impact on the community; moreso than making these products available to the community, her income is sufficient for her to commit to familial responsibilities and the reimbursement of this loan. In the future she intends to expand her business, and with an increase in income she looks to open a larger commercial establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Amina Luís S., 35 anos, natural de Maputo, cresceu com a mãe, para a sua sobrevivência, a mãe dedicava -se a pequenos negocio, negócios estes que apenas lhe permitiram que estudasse até 4ª classe. Depois dos 18 anos emigrou para a Vizinha a africa do Sul, tendo regressado a 2 anos, com os fundos que poupava na Africa do sul abriu um pequeno negocio de venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade e refrigerantes. Mãe solteira e responsável por uma família constituída por quatro pessoas, dentre os quais três são filhos. Com o crédito pretende aumentar o volume de negocio e providenciar produtos diversificados aos seus clientes. O seu negocio tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois para além de colocar os produtos perto do população, os seus rendimentos são suficiente para responder aos encargos familiar incluindo o reembolso de empréstimo. No futuro pretende expandir o seu negocio e dentro dos seus rendimento procurar abrir um estabelecimento comercial maior.

loans.use: To increase her stock of products

loans.name: Kpoliawoè

texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Ghana, Madame Kpoliawoe A. is married and other of five children. Along with her agricultural activities, she also sells "Kom" ( a food made with a corn base) that is known by the locals as a good addition to meals. Madame A. loves her work and is quite an expert in this culinary art, and she quickly gained the trust and business of all the neighbors. At present, she is asking for a loan of $850.00 which will allow her to stock corn and garantee her sales of "Kom." Also, she wishes to expand her business in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1975 au Ghana, Madame Kpoliawoè A. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. En plus de ses activités agricoles, elle vend du « Kom » (un aliment à base du maïs) qui est très apprécié par la population de sa localité pour mieux contribuer aux dépenses du foyer. Aimant bien son activité, très accueillante et maîtrisant bien l’art culinaire, elle a vite gagné la confiance de tous les habitants. A présent elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à faire un stock de maïs afin de garantir sa vente de « Kom ». Ainsi, pense t-elle rentabiliser plus ses activités pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To purchase corn to make "Kom."
